“Yeah!” Peach said, as if she… got an idea! “We owe you lot. We REALLY need to repay you.”

~~~

“How the fuck do you know her?” she asked.

“Well, I’ve saved her a few times while wandering New Donk City,” you explained. “I told you two, remember?”

The princesses shared a look. “I’ll go talk to her,” Peach sighed, getting up.

“Oh, you don’t have t-”

You reciprocated the kiss as you wrapped your arms around her, unaware of what was happening between Peach and Pauline…

...After a bit, you heard Peach’s voice yet again. “Ahem.”

Daisy separated you two, both of you panting. “Sorry, I couldn’t resist, since I had such a cute face to myself~”

Well, then I’ll just have to do this~” Peach leaned into you and pressed her lips to yours, and you reciprocated this new kiss, forcing Daisy in the somewhat awkward position of being next to all this. She stood still, in shock for a moment.

“Oh, I’m so sorry!” Daisy said as the waitress quickly put down the food, blushing a deep red.

“Oh, it’s fine, Princess!” the waitress assured her, nervously laughing. “I’ll just get a new uniform… and a new water…” She rushed away.

“Actually, I have to go to the bathroom first, before eating,” Peach said, getting up and going as you and Daisy chowed down.

...When Peach returned, smiling, you saw the waitress rush outside of the restaurant, seemingly upset, as she tried to cover her still-wet dress. Before you could comment, a manager rushed over to your table.

“VERY sorry about her, princesses, we had no idea she was flirting with customers!” he apologized.

...What?

“Oh, it’s fine, sir, just don’t let it happen again!” Peach forgave.

“...Yeah!” Daisy said, catching on. “How about we get a male waiter instead, just to be safe?”

“Whatever you need, princesses,” he complied, as he rushed to get one.

And what happened to Pauline?

The least you could do is apologize to one of them.

You decided to wait before asking to go to the bathroom, so the timing wasn’t suspicious. It worked, as the princesses seemed none the wiser of your true intentions. As you walked away, you decided the girl you were going to search for was...

"!!!" boy oh boy did you pay the split second Iris's cold voice hit the tips of your ears before you even realized she was there! How did she manage to sneak up on you like that?! She's a reploid in ultra heavy armor but you didnt so much as her the clanking of her metal boots!
Well, nevermind that! Youre busted! Your first day on the job and your commanding officer just caught you violating security protocols!

You try to hide the fear in your eyes as you turned to face Iris who despite inadvertently intimidating a lot more than she intended, was looking at you with just a simple questionable expression.
"Oh... um... I was..." you quickly come up with a good lie,"I was trying to call my dad. I just wanted to let him what happened to me, didnt wanna worry him, you know?"

"Hm... but I thought your father died during the Four Kings' War in the Levant over a decade and a half ago," HOW THE HELL DID SHE KNOW THAoh right she's got an entire database dedicated to yoWHY DOES SHE HAVE AN ENTIRE DATABASE DEDICATED TO YOU? "I believe he jumped in front of a live grenade to save his platoon if I remember reading the local news article correctly."

Despite being shaken up AND having bad memories reemerge, you were quick to recover.
"Sorry, I meant my old neighbor, Mr. Hochrin. ...He was kinda looking after me after my father's passing, so I guess I got used to calling him dad."
"Oh. Walter Hochrin? The man who owned the music shop 'Sha-Wing' before it was closed down to be used as a Repliforce recruiting office." Again, the database. And it still irked you, remembering how that metal milita forcefully shut down Mr. Hochrin's business... but by then, he was considering retiring anyways.

"I'm sorry [Y/N], but the Repliforce communications link is tightly restricted," she scolds you, "youre not allowed to use it to make personal calls. Not even I can use it to contact my brother unless it's strictly for security purposes!" Well, you managed to talk your way out of a very bad situation. Too bad you wont be able to call the Hunters any time soon. For the time being, youre stuck. And alone. In a world of robots. With this robot who might know more about you than you do!

"I'm sorry, ma'am," you sighed apologetically, though with a little authentic depression in your voice, "I wont do that again."
Iris was not done with you. She could detect something was up with you.

She tilted her head which nested an expression of curiosity.
"Is... something the matter, [Y/N]?" she asked you.
You shake your head, "No, it's nothing. I'm fine."
"No youre not," her suspicions grew as she leaned over to you, "I can detect very stressed emotional readings emitting from you. What is wrong?"

She wanted an answer and was not willing to budge until she got it. It's not like you could just flat out tell her that you dont feel cool being drafted against your will by robots and being made to serve one that knows TMI about YOU! But something told you that you couldnt flat out give her a bullshit answer, because she might see right through it.
Perhaps it would be best to give her a partial truth. Something you'd think someone like her would understand.

"Well..." you swallowed, "to tell the truth, ma'am..." You got up out of your seat and looked her in the eye, "I've been feeling very lonely lately."
"Lonely?" Iris's interests sparked.
"I mean, ever since more and more of your... of Repliforce's military cruised into my town, quite a bit of neighbors have moved away (or disappeared) and I've been seeing less and less... fellow humans around lately."
"I see..."
"In fact, it's been a few weeks since I've seen another human being around where I live. Seriously, all my neighbors are now robots. And now I've been drafted into an army full of robots. I feel like I'm half the planet away from home."
Your robot commanding officer just stared silently throughout your entire rant. You couldnt tell if she was offended by your statement, cuz her facial expression was unreadable. Still, thinking twice about you said, you felt a little bad.

"I'm sorry, ma'am," you bowed your head in apology, "I dont mean any offense by it. It's... just an experience I'm not very used to.” Surprisingly, you felt quite a bit better getting that off your chest. As if a huge nasty weight just got lifted off your back. Could THAT be the real problem you were having?! Were you really just upset with being lonely instead of being kidnapped?!

Whatever it was, the butterflies in your belly flew right out of it and you didnt feel quite as nervous of Iris's blank yet attentive stare.

“I… I understand,” she finally responded, “it must be difficult being away from your own kind for a while.” More like your own kind being away from you, but nonetheless. “It's true that us reploids are quite a bit different from you. In quite a lot of ways, it'd take several hours to list the many differences. However, despite us being more machine than organic, we do share a few similarities. We both communicate to each other eloquently, speak the same language, we can engage in the same past times and activities as you. We have emotional impulses that make us happy, sad, angry, frightened, and hundreds of other emotional responses like you.”

Iris stepped a bit closer and continued, “And of course, just like you humans, us reploids have families. Although I cannot recollect any history regarding my 'biological' parents, I at least have my brother… who is incredibly important to me. Just like how Mr. Hochrin is important to you… despite not being your biological father.” Aw shoot. She's got a point. Reploids actually having families, let along family bonds, was a major trait that they have in common with humans. Now bearing children on the other hand… well, you heard from hearsay that some have particular 'upgrades', but it's still just hearsay.

But before your mind could drift on that anomaly, Iris grabbed your hand and held it gently. Hm. It felt very soft and warm… like actual human skin instead of cold hard metal! Just the touch of her hand alone reminded you of her hug earlier. Honestly, you were surprised her breasts her soft and cushiony just like a human's! You were expecting those things to be hard as steel and nearly poking your eyes out! Heh.

“Dont worry, you'll fit in with us,” she assures you with a wink, “it's not like any of the others can tell youre a filthy fleshbag, anyways.” Her words combined with her touch really soothed your woes. It really took your mind off the database and whatever this damn thing her brother put around your neck is! Maybe. Just maybe. It wont be so bad.

Feeling a new boost of confidence, you return Iris's smile and give your commanding officer the proper salute.
“Thank you, ma'am! I'll do my best to serve you!”

“You'll do your best to ASSIST me,” she corrects you, “please dont think of me as your boss.”
You nodded, “Yes ma...I mean Iris.”

With that out of the way, Iris put her hands behind her back and peeked at your work.
“Speaking of which, having you finished doing the task that I assigned you?” Oh right, the whole report piling... er... DID you finish it?

112222222222221233.content:
You certainly did finish the report piling a while ago. It wasnt even difficult because about 99% of the reports in the stack were something you personally approved of. All but 2 papers were on the approval list!

Iris stared blankly at the insanely large stack of reports you deemed worthy of her approval.
"Um... THIS whole pile is what you believe I should approve?" she seemed a bit suspicious at first which was understandable.
But you nodded fully assured of yourself, "Absolutely ma-" Iris pointed at you with her eyebrows raised, "I mean Iris! These are all reform proposals and requests for federal funding that I personally think my city is in desperate need of. I honestly think they'll help it heal and recover back to it's former glory before the whole Maverick outbreak. We need all the help we can get."

She saw determination in your eyes and her CPU believed it was enough to warrant considering your opinion.

Your reploid superior nodded.

"Very well [Y/N]," she walked back over to her desk, "let's have a look at them, shall we?"

And that's when the fucking evaluation began. It was an evaluation that hinted that this was gonna be a LOOOOOOOOOOONG conscription service.

Iris looked over the first proposal.
"Request for four million dollars of federal funding to build a memorial monument?"
"To honor those who died in the Four Kings' War," you added, remembering your father's service (and Iris's whole database, "they never got properly honored for their service. Some of them didnt even get a proper burial. I'm sure their friends and families would really appreciate the sentiment."
"They truly do deserve such admiration," Iris admits, "from what I researched, it was described as 'Hell Split Wide Open' for a reason." She tapped the paper against her desk, "However, Repliforce has already arranged plans to include a special exhibit dedicated to the war in the Repliforce-Approved National History Museum over in City Square. So this monument is not needed."
"Still... I think the townsfolk here would appreciate it...."
"They will appreciate the many sights, stories, names, scenes, and Repliforce memorial souvenirs our History Museum will provide them when they attend," Wow. WOW. To say that with such a straight face. You have no words! "I'm sorry, [Y/N], but this funding request will have to be denied. I'm putting this into my denial pile." And so she put it in her denial pile.

*Bzzzzzz*

And by her 'denial pile', she means her bin with the shredder. Ouch.
"Next, please."

"Er...sure..." you hand her the next one, "a request to fund more public transportation."
"Oh! Repliforce is the process of building a high-speed bullet train system for your city. It should be completed by the end of the year."
"I dont think a lot of us can wait that long. After the whole car-hacking debacle during the Outbreak, very few people even have a car anymore. We need more buses to get around."
"I'm afraid that's out of the question. Far too many state-approved buses have failed Repliforce's hack-proof tests and the ones that do are outside of our budget. But not to worry. I read that walking more is good for a human's health and carpooling is good for the environment, not to mention very socially friendly. So this will have to go into my denial pile as well."
*Bzzzzz* Into the denial pile it goes.
"Next, please."

"Um... a request for funding to build more public schools."
"Repliforce has already provided those." Right. THEIR approved schools.
"Uh..." you needed to rephrase that, "more like schools... uh... run and taught by US... OUR teachers and staff."
"Unnecessary," she immediately rejects the idea, "Repliforce approved teachers are highly skilled and highly educated that have graduated with highest honors at other Repliforce-approved schools! Yours truly, included," she pats her chest with pride, "So for the good of your kind's future generations, this request will be going in my denial pile." *Bzzzzz* "Next, please."

"Errm... a proposal to reopen and restore the mega mall... that Repliforce is currently using as a base of operations," you hand her the paper and she doesnt take long to read it.
"I'm sorry, but our glorious leader has already arranged plans for that place," she states, "but not to worry. Repliforce is currently building a colossal mega mall completely filled with Repliforce-approved stores, merchandise vendors, kiosks, and food courts to serve your every need! It's sure to be our finest civilian commercial complex yet!"
"Great..." you smile nervously as you watch that paper go through the denial bin and come out a million denied shreds.
"Next, please."

It went on from there.
"A proposal to rebuild the Diamond Gate Bridge."
"Repliforce has already built a bridge. It doesnt need another."
"But it has a very strict security checkpoint every 500 feet. It takes nearly four hours to finally finish crossing it!"
"Repliforce Rule #759: Safety Always Comes Before Convenience. *Bzzzz* Next, please."
"A request for funding to repave downtown's cracked and destructed streets."
"There is currently a shortage of available construction equipment and asphalt material due to it being used for other specific purposes. As soon as those purposes are fulfilled, we will look into street paving." *Bzzzz* "Next, please."
"A proposal to negotiate an agreement and timeline to withdraw Repliforce forces-"
*BZZZZZZZZZ*
"Next, please."

Time passes and a total of ZERO requests and proposals have met Iris's approval and been spared from the shredder. Each and every one rejected and shredded. More public housing? Repliforce already has those. *Bzzz*. More forest reserves? The reploidal replicas suffice. *Bzzz*. Lifting the 'temporary' restrictions on meat exports? Repliforce's Department of Agriculture knows what's best. *Bzzz*
“Uh...Iris? There was another proposal behind that one you just shredded.”
“Oh? Well I'm sure it wasnt important.”
“It was involving Repliforce prison reform.”
“As I said. Wasnt important.”

The more papers were shredded, the lower your morale sunk. Despite Iris being awful cute and awful warming, she seemed outrageously faithful to her employers. Maybe you cant comprehend such behavior because you cant think like a machine create solely to serve said company that built it. Still, it made you so incredibly uneasy. Your woes were starting to come back.

After what seemed like the longest 20 minutes of your life, Iris had finally finished her evaluation. You can probably guess how many requests and proposals were accepted.

“Wow! We've got all that done in half the time it normally takes doing it by myself!” your reploid superior beams with a bit of glee, “brother was right. Tasks get done far quicker with an assistant.”
“G...reat...” you say, still reeling from the blow to the belly of your morale.

Iris then looked over to the clock.
“We've finished so much earlier than expected, I still have a few hours of free time left before my scheduled meeting with a representative of the Maverick Hunters.” The 'MH' works quickly get your attention. However, any and all ideas involving them would have to be put on the back burner for the time being.

“Since we have a lot of time to spare, how about I show you around?” she offered, “we've provided a plethora of entertainment ideal for tourism!” She sounded like she was advertising Repliforce to you! “The Repliforce Megaplex just opened up and it's currently playing a few really amazing state-approved foreign movies. I can reserve us a private screening with the really comfy seats!”
“Um...”
“Or if you'd like...” Iris added, “...we can go on a brief nature walk to clear our heads… at one of our artificial forest reserves. Sure, the trees and wildlife are animatronic, but theyre very convincing replicas, you'll hardly even notice the difference... other than the animals being 100% safe for human contact, of course!”

Again you felt the soft warm grasp of her surprisingly realistic hand grasp yours. Tight, but slightly soothing. Shaking off the brief moment of ease, you answer...

1122222222222212332.content:
"I guess I could go for a nature walk..." You replied.

Iris nodded and hugged you. After a few moments, she said, "Let me leave a message and then we'll be off."

So she typed away. Typed for longer than a simple message.

A little bit later, the two of you stepped off the Repliforce civilian bus. Iris happily sighed as she hugged your arm and placed her head on your shoulder.

The walk was pretty nice. As she said, there was artificial trees and animals.

You didn't like how every once in while the animals paused to look at you. Too many tales of zoos, parks, and the like where Robots went maverick and killed people.

None of the animal were aiming any weapons, claws or anything harmful at you. They just stared.

Had you known she had programmed the animals to take footage of you, you would have been calmer.

Then again, maybe not. You might've found that scarier than animals attacking you.

Several Repliforce workers showed up at your apartment and Iris's, packed up all the stuff, and brought it to a large apartment. One robot worker made sure to place a box in the center of the living room that was labeled '[Y/N]'s 'pornography'. All according to Iris's orders.

After an hour of walking, Irs asked, "I really enjoyed this walk. I almost hope that this would never end."

"Yeah, there's your meeting with the Maverick Hunters..." you said, hoping she'd let go of your arm.

Iris took her head off your shoulder as she said, "Yes, we should be getting back, so I can prepare for the meeting. Heh..."

"What's so funny?" You asked.

"Oh, nothing. Just that I bet a hunter I kind of know might be disappointed that I now have my eyes on someone else. I just find it funny for some reason," Iris replied as she brought you to the bus stop.

"Oh okay..." you replied, wondering if you would need to keep an eye out for Maverick hunters in the future. "So what will I do in the mean time?"

"Just wait for me in my office. The meeting will be a short one, only two or three hours long," Iris answered as you both stepped onto the bus.

===

As you waited in her office, you looked around. You looked at a few pictures on her desk. One was of her and her brother. Two were of you and seemed innocent, but they were ones of you taken without your knowledge.

You looked at her terminal and pondered if you should call for help. But before you could, you heard knocking. The door opened up and it was..

11222222222222123324.content:
In walked a young blonde girl in the blue and white nurse outfit/armor and matching nurse's cap/helmet with big green eyes that brought to you two separate and conflicting inquiries. One is that she too is not human, she's a reploid just like all the others... leaving you feeling a little more lonesome. Two is that you recognize this particular reploid. You recall her seeing her pop up several times during your volunteering jobs. She was there assisting the emergency medical staff, treating the wounded and the ill, as well as comforting the uh... soon-to-be widows, widowers, and orphans. It wasnt a task you had the emotional willpower to fulfill, so for someone like her to be routinely accomplish such a task with such a cheerful tone deserves admiration!

"Hi Cinnamon," you greeted her while attempting to hide the uneasiness from your facade. It was the least you could do for someone as strong-willed as her.

"Good afternoon, Mr. [Y/N]," she smiled and bowed, "I'm sorry if I disturbed you."

"No, you didnt disturb me at all," you were already disturbed long before she walked in, "what do you need?"
"I'm here to administer your routine health checkup," Cinnamon answers, "Repliforce requires all staff to receive their health examination to ensure Maverick virus prevention." She had you up until that last part.
"...Maverick virus prevention?" you squinted your eyes, "even me?"
"Especially you," she assures you, "though there's no existing report of any humans infected as of yet, the Maverick virus strains have been mutating over time and Professor Isoc theorizes that it's only a matter of time before it affects human immune systems as well." Add that to the ever-growing list of oddities that wont help you sleep at night!

"Er, ok, sure thing," youre awfully quick to comply, "the last thing I want is to become a Maverick. Uh, no offense?"
"Why would I be offended?"
"Nevermind. Sorry, it's just an expression that sounded better in my head." Luckily for you, Cinnamon paid your rude, out of line choice of wording no mind whatsoever. Instead, she happily focused all her energy on your checkup.

The checkup itself wasnt that uncomfortable, either. Her chest doubled as a tool organizer which she'd pop open to pull out a random tool for testing, then take notes. She pulled out a tongue depressor, put it in your mouth then took a note. She pulled out a thermometer, put it in your mouth, took a note. She pulled out a stethoscope, slipped it under your shirt and felt your heartbeat (her hands were awful cold by the way), then took a note. She checked your ear temperature, took a note, tested your reflexes, took a note, tested your blood pressure, took a note, nothing really out of the ordinary outside of the fact that it was a smiling fembot that's administering all this.

All it all, the checkup wasnt so bad.
...That is until THAT part of the checkup came. You know the one.

“Ok, Mr. [Y/N]. Would you please turn your head to the side?” Cinnamon wasted no time whatsoever to reach for your pants!
You quickly backed away in surprise… and out of fear where those ice cold titanium steel hands are gonna be!
“Er… i… is t-this really… appropriate?” you cringe nervously, “I-I-I mean… well, that part of a human's body is incredibly… sensitive… and well… reploids naturally have super strong grips!”
“Please dont be nervous. Having the necessary gentle grip to administer proper hernia examinations are requirements for nurse units,” Cinnamon assures you, “just relax and this will all be over really quick.”

You took a deep breath and swallowed hard, “O-o-ok.” Hoping for the absolute best, you unzip and pull down your pants and allow the reploid nurse slip her awful cold hand in your boxes and you try your best to think happy thoughts as you felt the icy cold grip surround your extra-sensitive man-pouch!

“Now please cough.”
*Cough* You coughed.
“A little harder this time.”
*Cough!* you cough harder.
“One more time. Cough really hard for me.”
*COUGH!*
“Good.”

You breathe a sigh of relief when her super-strong titanium steel hand leaves your boxers! You pray she doesnt plan on administering a prostate exam next!

Cinnamon scribbles another note. “Alright, now to check on that collar of yours.” The collar?! That thing the Colonel had put around your neck?! The one that he wouldnt tell you what it did… but hinted that it wouldnt be good for you if you didnt take good care of his sister?! THAT collar?!

The nurse pulled a remote out from her chest container and pushed a few buttons. Your collar immediately lit up and made several beeps and buzzing noises. Your curiosity sparked, but you dare not try anything funny as she removed a plate covering and inspected the wiring.

“Hmm,” she hummed as she observed, “no signs of any faulty circuity or short fusing. That's good. No trace of any warranty tampering, that's for sure. Oh wow, I havent seen a battery with THAT many milliamps in one of these before! I bet I could charge my laptop with this thing if I tweak it a little!”
“So… the collar's in good shape?” you randomly blurt out.
“So far,” she comments, “I still dont understand why such a thing is placed on Repliforce faculty.” Spark goes your curiosity.
“Oh?”
“Usually these particular collars are reserved for higher leveled prison or asylum inmates released to the public on parole.”
“What exactly are they supposed to do?” you finally ask the million dollar question.
“Specifically, these collars keep the parolees within their designated state-approved territory. Theyre not only trackable via satellite surveillance, but theyre also programmed to recognize specific areas and boundaries that the wearer can and cannot cross.” Interesting. Ooph, but interesting.

“And what happens if they go over the boundaries?” you gots to know, “they get shocked or something?”
“No. It'll give off an alarm that'll alert any and all nearby Repliforce personnel that youre breaking parole.” Oh. “However it IS programmed to discharge high voltage if it detects unapproved tampering.” OUCH! “So unless you feel the urge to be fried crispy, I wouldnt recommend trying to take it off.”

Shit. Why in the world would these tin cans feel the need to put one of THESE on you?! What's next? Are they gonna break your ankles so you dont try to run away like in that one movie starring that heavyset woman Nicholas Cage punched in the face in that other movie?!

"Uh... would it be safe to take a bath in this thing?" you ask.
"Of course," Cinnamon answers, "the casing is 100% completely waterproof. Even if youre caught in a monsoon, this collar will not short-circuit.” Youre really starting to regret going down this line of conversation. But at least you finally got answers to some nagging questions from the beginning. However, more question brew: What are the restricted boundaries the Colonel and his cronies set for you? Where can you go or not go? Why did they feel the need to put a parole collar on you to begin with? How do you get the stupid parole collar off without being electrocuted to death?

And those were only a FEW of the many, MANY questions brewing in your mind ever since the consciption began. Sadly, those will have to wait for another time. Until then, you can at least get one particular question answered.

"Alright, does that include the checkup?" you asked.

"Almost," Cinnamon answers, "I just have a brief line of questioning I need you to answer that I need to assess and evaluate before I can conclude the examination." Oh goodie. A pop quiz. "I'm gonna ask you a variety of questions and I need you to answer them as truthfully as possible, ok? Dont be afraid to be as brutally honest as you can."

"Ok," you comply with the questionnaire. It sounded easy, but you were sure it wasnt.
And you were right because of what this series of questions related to!
Speaking of questions, here's one: What were the questions she asked you related to?

112222222222221233243.content:
As if having your vulnerable exposed genitalia at the mercy of a reploid's cold strong grip didnt make you uneasy enough. Cinnamon's line of questions felt very unorthodox and way too personal, that if you believe your kind's military used it in their recruit interviewing, they'd be sued back to the dark ages!

But your options were limited. You had no choice but to answer them. Truthfully, cuz for all you know, Cinnamon had a lie-detector built into her CPU and is transmitted directly to the higher ups. Especially one particular higher up.

"First question," she reads off the questionnaire, "describe your marital status. Married, Single and Divorced, or Single and Never Married?"
"Single and Never Married," you answered. She took a note.
"If your answer is 'Single and Never Married', are you currently in a relationship with anyone? Yes or No?"
"No," you answered. She took another note.
"If your answer is 'No', is there someone you are currently interested in having a relationship with anyone? If Yes, please give his/her name." That's WAY too personal.
But you answer "No." But that wasnt specific enough.
" 'No' as in you dont currently have someone youre interested in or 'No' as in you DO have someone youre interested in, but refuse to give his/her name?"
"No as in there isnt currently someone."
"Thank you," Cinnamon scribbles a few more notes.

It got worse from there.
"Ok, these next questions are very important," Cinnamon explains, "please listen very carefully and do not hesitate to ask me to repeat them or reword them if you dont understand a question clearly."
"Ok," you answer nervously.

"First questions," she reads, "which of the following describes you? Straight, Homosexual, Bisexual, or Other?" Other? "If the answer is 'Other' please describe."
"Straight," thankfully it was an easy question. OFFENSIVE, but easy.
"Ok then," Cinnamon's tone lights up a little as she jots down a note, "next question: what part of a female's body would you consider gives you the most sexual stimulus? A female's chest or a female's hips?" GOOD LORD ALMIGHTY!
"Is that seriously part of the questionnaire?" you question.
"Yes it is," she answers with no hesitance, "Chest or Hips?"
You took a deep breath as your face went red, "...Hips." A man of class.

"Alright," she takes a slightly long note, "next question: which of the following would you consider to be an ideal girlfriend? Human, Reploid, or Other? If the answer is 'Other' please describe." The bloody hell kind of question is that?!
"Other," you answer, "I dont think it really matters if she's a human or reploid."
"Interesting," she comments as she jots down notes, "next question: would you consider having a relationship with a co-worker? Yes or No?"
"Uh... that would depend on how well we-"
"That's not one of the choices," she interrupts, "the choices are yes or no."
You sigh hard, "Yes.... I guess?"
"Nice," she remarks before jotting down a note, "please pay close attention to this next question: In the unlikely event that you and your co-worker were trapped in a tight dangerous confined space with no hope of escape or being rescued, would you consider making love to your co-worker before you and her inevitably die? Yes or No?" This is getting ridiculous. But whatever! Fine!
You shrug your arms, "I guess... if SHE'S up for it too... yes, probably."

Oh she wasnt done.
"How often would you say you relief personal stress via self-stimulation on an average week?"
You squinted your eyes, "I'm sorry, I dont understand the question."
"Allow me to rephrase it," Cinnamon quickly rephrased it, "how often do you masturbate per week?"
Keeping a straight face, you politely ask, "Can I please skip that question?"
"I'm sorry, all these questions are mandatory according to strict Repliforce guidelines," Cinnamon explains, "if you need more time to properly answer, feel free to take it."

You didnt need more time. You had an answer.
You lower your head and answer, "3 to 4 times a week, I guess..." Tsk. Liar.

"Hm," Cinnamon's 'hm' sounded a little more interested than it shouldve been! "Next question: If you were offered, would you be interested in routine assistance with self-stimulation from a third party?"
"NO THANK YOU," seriously, who wrote this crap?!

"Well then, we're down to the final question," she states. FINALLY.
"What?" you groan with irritation.
"Is the ability to produce future offspring important to you? Yes or No?" WOW. That's a pretty head scratching question right there. Not to mention, it's something you gotta take into account while youre your commanding officer's boyfriend...
You take a few breathes, having a difficult time coming up with an answer, "Well... at the moment... hm. That's a tough question to answer."
"Feel free to take your time," she insists.
You glance around, bite your lip, inhale and exhale, and at the very end, youre sure there was only one answer, "...To be frank, I probably would like to have children eventually. I gotta say the answer's yes."

Cinnamon doesnt respond. She just takes notes. She takes a lot of notes actually. She writes for almost a whole minute and you just sit there and wait patiently for her to finish. Penny for her thoughts, but you got a feeling you dont wanna know what she's thinking.

"Alright. That concludes the examination," Cinnamon FINALLY ends this bizarre episode, "thank you so much, Mr. [Y/N] for your patience and compliance."
"N...no problem," it was hard to say that with a straight face. The blonde reploid nurse extends her hand and you willingly shake it, taking note of the cold, rather stiff mechanical grip. Quite unlike Iris's warm gentle humanlike grip. You'll assume that her chest isnt similar to Iris's, either.

"I should return to my post. Here is my card," she hands you a business card. An 'Isoc Pharmaceuticals (a Repliforce partner)'s business card with her name, company address, and phone number on it, "if you had any questions or concerns, or if you simply feel the need to talk, feel free to call me. Use the phone number on the back if it's after hours." Her PERSONAL phone number was written on the back of it!

"Thank you again for your cooperation," Cinnamon bowed, "I hope to see you again soon!"
"Thank you," you bowed back, "bye Cinnamon." With that, the perky professional (but slightly disturing) nurse left the office. You sighed hard after finally getting some well earned peace and quiet.

Unusual, but at least you had SOME answers. It didnt make your forced conscription any easier to manage, though.

Ugh... all this drama is making you tired. You were nearly worn out. Maybe a little nap will ease your stress. Feeling that was the case, you lean back in your chair and close your eyes.


...For about as long as a SECOND cuz something interrupted that nap before it could even start! What was the interruption?

You glared at the alarm ringing for a few moments until you realized that you didn't quite recognize that Klaxon pattern.

So you went to the computer and checked the base's personal notice board. Your jaw dropped as you read the top two posted topics.

'General of the Repliforce has been assassinated by Slash Beast!'

'Space Station Eurasia has been hijacked by Mavericks and is on a crash course for Earth!'

If you had been standing, you'd have fallen on your ass. But since you were already on a chair, you were safe.

Reading some of the scientific topics, you read that if Eurasia hits Earth, then Humanity would be nearly exterminated. You hoped that the Repiforce and the Maverick Hunters would be able to stop the Eurasia crash. True, while the base that you were in would be perfectly safe, you did have friends and family who aren't as lucky.

Then again, they didn't have a cute-yet-creepy reploid after then.

Then you realized something. Something that sent chills down your spine. Colonel is now in charge of the Repliforce. Iris, while a civilian-type reploid, has Colonel wrapped around her little finger.

"So Iris has even more power than before," You muttered as you stood up and went to the door. When the open button didn't work, you tried to open the door yourself. When that failed, you went back to the desk, muttering, "Great, I'm stuck here. Might as well try to contact someone and see if someone will help me."

The moment you tried to make a topic, a window opened up that read, 'Certain features of this terminal has been locked until the state of emergency has either passed or lessened. Please contact your superiors if you require assistance.'

You hit the desk and glared at the screen. Sure, you could still read and check out news, but contacting anyone was impossible.

After you calmed down, you began to stroll around, pressing and pulling various things as if you might find some secret exit.

Eventually, you managed to find out that there was a pullout couch in the wall and used that as a bed. Why that was there, you had no idea.

Nor did you know about the hidden cameras watching you, sending info to Iris, who didn't care about how many human deaths she had to cause to ensure that you would be with her.

When you woke up, you discovered that...

11222222222222123324333.content:
It felt as if you woke up from a several year coma even though it's only been a couple of hours, because the news you read didnt seem like it couldve happened overnight.
Iris didnt just receive a promotion after the General's assassination, she received an UPGRADE! This 'civilian-type' Reploid just became a full-fledged Repliforce army commander. A position that's only reserved for COMBAT reploids for obvious reasons! And it wasnt a rank you just inherit. It's a rank that needs to be EARNED. This information changed a lot of things you thought you knew about Iris. Sure, she was a PROUD devoted overseer of the biggest and possibly most dangerous Reploid militia on this dying earth, but you never knew she was actually a combat type.

"There's a lot about her I dont know about," you couldnt help but tell yourself out loud. And right now youre superior was leading the fray against what may very well be a coup. At the same time, a new uprising was brewing. Now that news spread quickly that Eurasia is on a crash course for earth, certain second-class citizens have become a bit overzealous and are placing the blame on their reploid 'protectors'. Combined with conspiracies of the Maverick Hunters and Repliforce higher ups having shady dealings as well as the sudden death of a feared leader, and a dangerous radical anti-Reploid terrorist organization known as the Community rises from the debris.

One article of an MH-funded bank bombed by the Community later and you sink back into the couch with your jaw dropped. The atmosphere got so tense.
"I shouldnt have woken up," you whispered to yourself.

A cold hard brittle week passes by as you acclimate yourself to your new job. It was lonely, because Iris wasnt there what with her being far too busy with her new job. It wasnt all that difficult, though. Mostly handed paperwork, reviewed city proposals and mail over good ones to be approved (and possibly put through the denial pile!), as well as continue your volunteer work overseeing construction, attending social gatherings, assisting Cinnamon (and turning down her offer of physicals!) and even passing out aid.... just with armed Repliforce bodyguards that monitor your every move.
"Hey, ya think the Community's gonna get big?" a human refugee whispered to you as you handed him his box of daily rations.
"I dont know," was the only answer you could give him without pissing off your armed guards.
"No talking!" one of the guards yelled at the refugee, "grab your aid and move on! NEXT!"

You really missed Iris even after finally getting settled in your cozy apartment complex, despite being suspicious of the mysterious box marked '[Y/N]'s Pornography'. There, you had nobody to talk to. Your body guards who stood outside your door werent exactly sparking conversationalists. You couldnt call anybody even if you didnt know your calls were being monitored, because everybody you knew either changed their number or couldnt answer the phone for particular reasons.

You were lonely. Very lonely. The only time during the week you got to see Iris was during a press conference on tv.

"-Although my brother did suffer a severe injury from the attack, his strong will and determination combined with backup from the intense discharges of excessive telekinetic energy from his devoted sister ultimately won the day, subduing the traitorous Duff McWhalen and reclaiming the Atlantis Oceanographic Museum! It should be repaired and running once again very soon! Now are there any questions?"

One reporter raised his hand, "Tom Conway of Paradigm News. Many of us are concerned about the Space Station Eurasia heading toward the earth. Has there been any progress about stopping the collision? And have you found out the ones responsible for hijacking?" Good question. A very good necessary question.

"Both Repliforce and the Maverick Hunters have taken major steps to delay it's course," Iris explains, "while I cannot go into any detail regarding the identities of the hijackers because they are still being reviewed, I can say that our hackers have had success diverting it's gravitational pull. Our allies in the Maverick Hunters are also looking into developing a weapon to blast it out of our orbit. Much detail is still classified." Well, that sounds like good news, you guess. "Yes?"

"Rhonda. With AIN Channel 4," the reporter introduces herself, "um, the loss of your renown General mustve been very hard on you and everyone at Repliforce. Some would think such a horrible would event would strengthen your enemies' resolve. How do you and your comrades manage to cope regarding this tragedy? And how has this sudden change in your career and list of responsibilities affected you personally?"
"It has been very difficult for all of us," Iris answers, "He was a wise and noble leader. The Colonel had never looked up to anyone quite as much as him. It truly was devastating. However, we are all still proud soldiers. We will still fight on and we will still continue to pursue our dream formed at Repliforce founding. The coward responsible for this heinous act will see justice. No traitor, outlaw, maverick, or bigoted fleshbag will stop us from realizing our goal. Our future will be bright. Nothing will put out our fire." Aw, that was so deep. But then came the next question.

"Armand Velasquez, City of New Hope Times," the reported says, "there has been leaked memos posted in certain tabloids that shortly before the General's assassinations, certain members within your organization have funneled money into the bank accounts that belonged to Sigma fanatics." OH SHIT. YOU DID NOT HEAR ABOUT THAT! "Is there any truth to this accusation and has there been any investigation regarding it?"

Iris suddenly went silent for a moment. She just stared the reporter's way. There was no change on her face, but you'd hate to imagine the thoughts racing in her CPU. Finally after a while, she simply answers, "I cannot comment on any such alleged events in question. Thank you everyone." And immediately after that, the conference was over and all the reporters were forced escorted out of the building. She certainly had her hands full.

But that doesnt mean Iris forgot about you. Not by a long shot. She missed you just about much as you missed her if not more... especially considering she liked reviewing HQ surveillance footage with you in it on her down time. There was one line of footage that peeked her interest so much, she would rewind and repeat it several times: Cinnamon's questionnaire. Or rather, the last question.

"Is the ability to produce future offspring important to you? Yes or No?"

"He seems so nervous," Iris appeared to be narrating to herself, "he's looking around the room. Breath. Breath. Breath."

"Well... at the moment... hm. That's a tough question to answer."
"Well... at the moment... hm. That's a tough question to answer." She watched until she memorized your every word and matched your periods of stalling to the exact second! "Still more breathing."

"Feel free to t-"
"Brat pretends to comfort him," Iris narrates over Cinammon's response, "he glances around the room again. He finally looks back at Brat. He bites his lip. Pause. '...To be frank, I probably would like to have children eventually. I gotta say the answer's yes.' "
She then abruptly stops the footage right there.
Again, her CPU works into overdrive, processing the many thoughts flowing through it as she stares at the black screen in silence.

Unknown to her, someone's been spying on her the whole time through the doorway!

Who was spying on her?

A silent Zero stared at Iris as she gave all her attention to the terminal in her office.

Eventually, he coughed, getting her attention.

"Zero! I... I didn't notice you there!" Iris quickly said as she spun around to face him.

"Iris... We're getting ready to put the final touches on the Enigma cannon, but what were you doing?" Zero asked.

Many excuses ran through Iris's mind. Some would work at the moment, but it would mean denying her love for you to someone and it would fall apart if she spent time with you afterwords. Iris loved you so much that denying her feelings for even a moment was unthinkable.

Recalling that Alia was an expert at Reploid engineering and some theoretical plans to save the human race, Iris answered, "His name is [Y/N]. He currently is under my care, as he is a possible test subject for Project Arcadia."

Zero asked, "Project Arcadia? What is it?"

It will be a paradise that allow humans and Reploids to live in harmony together. Some humans will even be given a chance to cross the line, so to speak and become both reploid and human. Thus they will be able to help guide everyone to peace, as they will have the viewpoints of both humans and reploids," Iris explained.

Sure, you might refuse her offer. but wanting to die can be seen as a sign of insanity and thus would allow Iris to ignore your pleas and allow her to extend your life to whatever she wanted it to be.

Once alone, Iris took out a disc. If you didn't like her current body, then she'd have any number of other bodies to love you with.

But it required the Enigma Cannon to fail and a space shuttle to be used.

The only problem with that is Iris's eyes was Zero. He was needed for the large scale infection, as he could spread or absorb any version of the Maverick virus with a mere touch.

Otherwise, Iris would have to settle to pick and choose and hope she would never be caught.

After placing the disc in the space shuttle's computers, Iris headed to the Engima Cannon control room.

"Enigma Cannon ready to fire! Eurasia is almost into position!" Alia said.

'Alia... I need her skills to upgrade [Y/N]'s body... Perhaps I should use my backup virus on her, just in case,' Iris thought as she had her finger over the fire button.

"Three! Two! One!" Alia shouted. "Now!"

"Firing," Iris calmly said as she pressed the button. The Enigma Cannon was a....

1122222222222212332433331.content:
Everybody on the face of the dying planet with a tv or at least a functioning radio was tuning in the Enigma Canon firing in the direction of the falling space station. You watched in on one of the only handful of Repliforce-approved channels from your 4KTV in your apartment. Cinnamon viewed the event from her portable television in her tent. The Colonel watched the firing from outside his balcony. X viewed it via the live footage airing at the Maverick Hunters HQ. Dr. Cain watched the event from the tv in his hospital room as the nurse bearing a Community bracelet brought him his dinner tray.

From this brief moment, the world went silent.

Until the earsplitting noise of a titanic orbital-piercing beam of Death Star magnitude erupted the planet and collided with the falling station! Then when the earthquakes finally stopped, the world went silent again.
Until kaboom.

The explosion blotted out the sky in sheer absolute ultra bright light that was like staring directly into the sun if the sun was closer to the earth than the moon! You couldnt even bare watching the bright light through the tv without looking away! When the sky finally cleared, everybody checked the satellite footage: Space Station Eurasia was no more. Just dirt and debris floating in space forever lost. Whatever was left of the Maverick Virus there was praying for a quick death. MISSION COMPLETE.

The Hunters cheered and applauded. Dang near everybody who witnessed this event cheered and celebrated. Iris... just stared. She just gazed up at the sky in such deep thought. It's like she didnt know whether to celebrate or be depressed. On one hand, this was a tremendous opportunity that was wasted away. She had so much planned had the canon failed and the station collided, putting so many necessary events into effect. With it destroyed, she's back to Square One. But on the other hand, this was a joyous occasion. For Repliforce was now the savior of human and robotic kind. This meant that many that did not like her, did not trust her, and would get in her way would now love her, respect her, and maybe even HELP her. One especially. This meant more opportunities for her. One door closed but another bigger, brighter, golden door opened. Repliforce's dream will be realized no doubt. HER dream will be realized no doubt. And best of all, HE probably witnessed this spectacle and is looking up at her with amaze and admiration right about now!

"GO IRIS!!!" you cheered her on as the camera focused on her in the middle of the cheering crowd.

Iris couldnt help but smile and clap along with the others, now filled with newbound confidence... and more potential brainstorming.
The camera even picked up Zero high-fiveing his comrades and when it came to Iris… she didnt even bat an eye to him. She just walked off still staring into space with a bright smile on her face. The camera spent a large amount of time focusing on Zero with his ignored hand in the air and an awfully disappointed frown as he watched Iris walk away from him.
“Oh yeah, he got rejected,” commented one of your bodyguard.
“Shut up ya twit!” quipped the other bodyguard.

A much brighter more vibrant week passes and Repliforce is reaping in the rewards. Success with the destruction of Eurasia really put them on the map. Foreign funding increased dramatically. Loads of major corporate brands and making deals for endorsements (ie, McDonalds is coming out with their new sandwich, the McColonel!). A big film industry is already in the process of making a movie about their exploits! Geez, not even the Maverick Hunters havent gotten THIS league of praise no matter how many times they defeated Sigma!

But if Repliforce is sitting pretty, that means YOURE sitting pretty. Everybody working there got themselves a nice bonus which meant you got yourself some extra spending cash to spruce up the apartment building youre still trapped in (they wont let you move out). It's a pleasant luxurious prison. Your coworkers still treat you like a 2nd class citizen and your bodyguards still aint any more talkative to you AND you miss your family and friends… but a step up is still a step up!

One day you were checking through the recent list of proposals and requests to be reviewed for approval.
“Let's see… more transportation funding… build another YMCA… improved waste management… demand for an alleged Repliforce police brutality investigation… 'Shutdown Project Arcadia'?”
That last proposal caught your interest. The draft was submitted by 'Phoenix Black, Human Rights Proponent and Community Organizer for Public Wellbeing'. It had a golden sun-shaped insignia that you didnt recognize stamped on it.

You squinted your eyes as you skimmed through it. You couldnt read the text. It was typed up completely in gibberish. Or code.
Though you had no idea what this proposal was about, the name 'Project Arcadia' gave you bad feelings. You havent a clue what it is, but you coulda sworn you heard a few reploidal colleagues whisper that name a few times in jest.
Come to think of it, that insignia... have you seen that somewhere before?

*Knock knock knock*

Suddenly, somebody knocked on your door. Normally your bodyguards would be at the door to greet the guest (or tell him/her to piss off) but they seemed to have stepped out at the moment.

You quickly hide the eerie 'proposal' in a drawer below the unopened box that had '[Y/N]'s Pornography' scratched up with a sharpie and quickly head to the door.

Immediately upon opening it and acting on impulse, you quickly give your guest the proper salute! Your guest happen to be...

“Hello, [Y/N]. Are you free to talk for a bit?” Zero asked.

“I’ve got nothing but time, so yes,” You answered, stepping to the side and letting him in. You noted that your guards were nowhere in sight.

After Zero sat down on a chair, he asked, “How are you?”

As you began to make tea, you answered, “I’m alright. Kinda lonely, since Repliforce ‘hired’ me.”

“Hired how?” Zero asked.

“I volunteered to work and Colonel decided to enlist me under Iris’s command,” You answered. You wanted to give the truth, but didn’t think Zero would believe you. “Things sorta spiraled from there. Iris is kinda clingy when we meet each other.”

Zero smiled for a moment before muttering, “Yeah, she was during the Soul Eraser incidents...”

“So I’m not the first one to receive her affections, eh?” You asked as you put the tea pot and some cookies down on a table between the chair Zero was on and the couch you then sat down on.

“Perhaps. How is she?” Zero asked.

“You meet her more than I do,” You answered.

“I’m more interested in how you and Iris interact,” Zero said with the tiniest of frowns.

"She's like a girl in love whenever we meet," You began. "But..."

You took a deep breath and sighed. “I haven’t met another human in weeks and I think she's responsible. I wouldn’t be surprised if I was the only human in this city.”

Thankful that being in the 0th Special Unit requires keen observational skills, the red maverick hunter thought, ‘Either he’s the best actor I’ve seen or Iris is going maverick.’

“Why not call someone?” Zero asked, pouring a cup of tea.

“All calls are monitored. Even then, I have to get permission first and I really haven’t gotten it as of late,” You sighed.

“And the collar?” Zero asked before taking a sip.

“Something for my safety, I guess. I think Iris uses it to keep track of me,” You answered as you got a cup for yourself.

‘Gonna need to run Iris under a virus scan. This is breaking a law or two and needs a reason for it,’ Zero thought. “So you’re trapped here. Any idea why?”

You stared at your tea. In a near whisper, you replied, “I think… Iris is obsessing about me. I’m scared.”

With a chuckle and a smirk, Zero asked, “Why be scared? Isn’t she a beauty? Sure, she’s a reploid, but the armor is removable and we do almost look like humans without it. Heck, half the models in any given swimsuit calendar are actually reploids.”

Had you been looking up, you would have noted that Zero’s eyes were anything but pleasant. More akin to preparing for a quick strike to knock you out and taking you into jail… or the morgue.

“Yes, she’s lovely, but… It’s like something is wrong. A relationship is a two-way street and what I’m going through is either like I’m a pet or a submissive husband who is like two steps away from being tied to her bed,” you said before shuddering. “Last time we did anything close to romantic was a walk through a park and that was quite some time ago.”

“So… anything else?” Zero asked.

“I had a meeting with a nurse reploid where she talked with me about sexual matters. I think Iris sent her,” You answered. “Her name was… Cinnamon? Yeah, that was her name. It happened when the Eurasia incident first broke out.”

“I’ll check the records and see if anything was out of the ordinary about that meeting,” Zero replied.

“That would be nice,” You said.

112222222222221233243333125.content:
Just when you were enjoying the company, Zero got up out of his seat and was ready to leave.
"Alright, I think I heard everything I needed for now," he tells you, "I better get going before they find out I'm here."
"Th...they dont know youre here?" you asked.
He smiled nervously, "Well, not exactly. I dont think they'd welcome me if they knew WHY I came."
"Wh-what do you mean?!"
"Forget about it," Zero changed the subject, "there's still some things I'll need to know. I'll keep in touch with you as soon as I can."
"Uh... alright," you tell him.
"Good," with that, he heads out the door, "Iris is a real good friend of mine. Keep a good eye on her, ok?"
"Wont be hard," you say, "Bye Zero." He waves you off as he leaves. You didnt get to see him off longer than a few seconds before he teleports out of there! Must be nice to be able to teleport. You spend quite a bit of time pondering that teleportation ability. You wonder how it works? Are there limits to where one can teleport? Is it true that if you teleport into a wall, you'd be crushed to death? Do you need special training to use it properly?

Actually, you didnt really care at all about teleporting. You just wanted something to take your mind off Iris. It gave you a LITTLE hope that maybe Zero'll help you out. That is unless HE'S got a problem too! You heard a little about HIS backstory! And that stare he was giving off... if you were a reploid, you'd have probably seen a huge 'WARNING' message pop up on your screen!
Nonetheless, it did a good job keeping your mind occupied for about 2 hours.

But after those 2 hours, someone knocked on the door. You sensed absolute dread coming from the other side. Still, you had to answer it. And you had to salute the three soldiers staring your way.
"You need to come with us," the head troop ordered. You assumed the position and they grabbed you and dragged you off to your destiny!

After the shortest most uncomfortable perp walk you've ever had the privilege of experiencing, the goons reached their destination: your old junior high school… occupied as yet ANOTHER Repliforce base.
A depressing walk down memory lane later and youre taken to what used to be the Principal's office. One of your goons knocks on the door.

“Come in,” said the Colonel's erudite yet awfully intimidating voice on the other end. Bad feeling. A very bad feeling.

Youre dragged inside to see the Colonel currently filling out some documents that his reploid secretary hands him.

“Hey!” one of the goons whispers as he lets go of your arm, “salute your superior!”
You swallow hard and give him the salute, “Sir.”

“[Y/N],” he said your name in a stern tone like a disappointed parent, “it has come to my attention that you engaged in an unauthorized rendevous with a Maverick Hunter, Commander Zero.” Er, is that a problem? Theyre allies, right? “Are you aware that Zero had given no prior notice ahead of time that he speak with you in private, therefor your meeting was unsanctioned?” Oh boy.
“I wasnt aware, sir,” you answer. He wasnt done.

“It has ALSO come to my attention that in this unauthorized rendevous, you spoke very ill of your commanding officer?” OF COURSE.
“Oh snap!” you heard one of the goons chuckle quietly.
Despite being a little scared AND embarrassed, you try to keep a straight face.

“You have made quite a few rather damning allegations about Lieutenant Iris,” he states while still writing his notes, “and to a member of a foreign armed forces corp. To some, this can seen as treason.” That big 'T' word broke your facade. You knew what he was implying by that! Even though you didnt willingly join his posse, no good can come from being seen as treasonous to him!

“Look, I'm not a traitor!” you speak up, “it was never my intention to hurt your sister in any way.” You take a deep breath, “The truth is I'm really worried about her.”
“There's nothing to worry about other than making outrageous exaggerated claims to foreign intelligence.”
“But that's the thing! Theyre NOT exaggerated!” you explain to him, “I mean her… behavior… the way she's been treating me…. the numerous hidden cameras I found in my apartment… the archive… hell that silly box of porn she put on my table!” The goons couldnt help but laugh at that.
“Silence!” the Colonel shut them up.
You continued, “Think about it! Does this not sound off to you?”

“It's no surprise she's interested in you,” he didnt sound the least bit phased by all that, “you should be flattered. She's had many reploid admirers that were never so lucky.”
“Trust me, I'm very flattered sir,” you say, “however, THIS kind of obsession, it's not normal. It feels incredibly similar to that of a stalker. I'm worried there could be something wrong with her.”
“Nonsense,” big bro wont give that a thought, “Iris is perfectly balanced, body and mind.”
“Are you sure?”
“Of course I am.”
“I'm sorry sir, but I dont feel safe like this,” you give it to him straight, “what if her behavior escalates? Who knows what she might end up doing? ...She might be going Maverick.”

Everything got quiet as soon as you said the M word! The goons froze up, the secretary gasped, and the Colonel finally put down his pen and stared you right in the eyes. He got right up out of his seat and he was a hair's away from clocking you!

“Dont you EVER make that allegation about my sister again!” he coldly warned you.
“What else can I call it?” you keep going, “there IS something wrong with her! As her brother, you should know that-”
“I will not tolerate this insubordination!” he cut you off, “Iris has given you a remarkable opportunity with a bright beautiful future and THIS is how you repay her?!” You had enough. It's not like you wanted this job anyway!
“Fine! Then take it away!” you say, “I didnt wanna join Repliforce anyway! I quit!”
“I will not accept your resignation,” he refuses, “you will serve my sister to the best of your abilities until youre completely incapable of doing so!”
“You cant do that!” something made you blurt that out, “this is illegal!”
“What did I tell you about choosing your words more carefully?” he tells you just before he tapped your special collar! What an asshole! And you were actually trying to help him!
Still, you had to keep going, “I have chosen my words carefully. Your sister is in danger. If you dont help her, she may very well become a Maverick.” That did it. The room got dead quiet yet again. The Colonel looked like he wanted to rip your head clean off and then gift wrap it and give it to Iris for Christmas! But he was a well disciplined soldier. He kept his cool. He was polite, he was professional, and he had a plan to kill everybody he met.

“Step outside,” he ordered everyone else to leave the room. Just you and him.

“I could kill you for that traitorous attitude of yours,” he warned you, “but the last thing I want to do is make my sister cry. So I'll be lenient. You are hereby forbidden from leaving your apartment. Until further notice, any and all communication and visitation privilege is now revoked. You may not speak with anyone outside of Repliforce faculty. Your phone line will be cut and I will send an inspector to check up on you regularly.” He stopped for a few seconds, but you knew he wasnt done. Then he added, “And if your treasonous behavior continues, I will have you operated on, broken down, reprogrammed, and THEN you will serve my sister to the best of your abilities! Is that understood?”

That threat left a nasty image in your head. Truly a living nightmare.
“Loud and clear sir,” you give up. He's gone too. Looks like you got TWO Mavericks to deal with. With that now ringing true, you were immediately escorted out of the Colonel's office.

“You got a lot of nerve talking to the Colonel like that,” one of the guys restraining you said.
“You better pray that Iris never changes her mind about you,” the other one warned, “cuz as soon as she does-”
“Enough!” the head goon shut them up, “let's just toss this dog back in his kennel!”

So they did. They chucked you back in your apartment like a sack of potatoes and put up another security lock on the door so you cant get out. With the Colonel's orders set in stone, it seemed all but hopeless for you. No matter how much worse Iris gets, you were hers. You can either accept your fate or be made to accept your fate. You shudder to think how they'll make that possible.

“Lord save me,” you whisper to yourself as you sit on your couch staring at the floor.

You stared at the blonde reploid as you shifted to the side to let her in. She had a large tablet with her.

"Hello, [Y/N]. You might not know me, but I'm Alia. I'm normally the Navigator, operator, and computer specialist for X and Zero," Alia said as the door closed.

"So pardon me for asking, what are you here for?" you asked as the two of you sat down.

"Oh, just wondering if you'd like your collar upgraded," Alia answered with a small-yet-friendly smile.

"I'd actually like it removed," You replied.

Alia frowned for a moment before she said, "I'm sorry, but that isn't an option at this moment."

You sighed, "So what are the upgrades?"

She gave you the tablet, which had an image of your security collar. She swiped the screen. Now the collar had a little speaker/microphone and she said, "One is a speaker add-on, so you can contact or be contracted by a select few."

"Select few? I'm already suspicious about the collar. How do I know that some pervert won't be listening in on me whenever they want?" You asked, getting mad.

"I assure you that the only ones that will have access to your collar will be the Maverick Hunters and the Repliforce. Both forces will respect your privacy," Alia replied.

"Whatever. So what other upgrades are there?" you asked.

Another swipe. Now it had a few red gems added. "An energy shield and an emergency teleporter, just in case you are attacked or are about to receive a fatal injury."

You nodded before saying, "That does sound useful. So that's a maybe."

A third swipe. Now it had some little camera-doodad things. "A holographic version of the speaker. This can also be used as a computer,"

You frowned, "Interesting, but I still worry for my privacy."

Alia nodded. "That will always be a concern. After all, today's unbeatable security is tomorrow's weak spot."

"So enough of the upgrades for now. I have a few questions. Like, what is Project Arcadia?" you asked, handing back the tablet.

"Well, the incident with Space Station Eurasia has a lot of people and reploids panicking. Commander Iris wants to create a secure place for reploids and humans to live in. It's only theoretical at the moment, as talks are also being done about blurring the line between humans and reploids," Alia answered.

You blinked a few times. You asked with quite a bit of concern, "How does she intend on doing that? On either of those? Don't' we call that last one a cyborg.... Which, by the way, is just a human with robot parts. Don't we have those already?"

Alia sighed, "Technically yes, but this is blurring it even further, like allowing reploids to give birth to more reploids and having them grow up like humans. Maybe even let them give birth to humans as well. There’s also another theoretical project about letting humans live as long as reploids. Commander Iris is trying to convince me to go back to my previous job as a Reploid researcher for it all, but I'm having my doubts. I left that job for some very good reasons. At the moment, I'm safe, but I suspect she might find a way to force me back, so I'll be forced to work on Project Arcadia and more. "

"Can't you just quit?" You asked.

Alia sadly smiled at you. "I know too much and I don't want my memory wiped. That and the Maverick Virus still exists. Fight the good fight, y'know?"

"So what do you know of Phoenix Black?" You asked.

"Never met the man, but I've been told he's a rabblerouser who is against any human modifications that contain technology,” Alia answered. “I haven’t heard of him behind any of the more violent attacks against reploids or humans, but I wouldn’t be surprised if he was connected to them.”

You sighed as you covered your face with your hands. “It all sounds like a minefield.”

Alia sighed, “Tell me about it. How about we talk about something else or do something happier?”

“Like what?” You asked.

She tapped her chin in thought before putting a deck of cards on your desk. “How about a friendly game of poker?”

“What are the stakes?” you asked as she produced a bag of poker chips.

"Loser does a favor for the winner?" Alia asked.

You nodded. "I guess I could use my break for this."

112222222222221233243333141.content:
The Repliforce logo on Alia's tablet was not just for branding purpose. It clearly had a backdoor for certain Repliforce intelligence agents to spy on their 'allies' in the Maverick Hunters. In this case, Commander Iris was watching the surveillance footage between you and Alia emitting from the tablet in displeasure. Though her stare was blank and her facade was pure stonewall, millions of thoughts emitted through her CPU as she tapped her finger on the desk impatiently.

Alia did not give prior notice that she was gonna meet privately with the Commander's prized subordinate today nor was she given permission to do so. A major violation. However, Iris was in no position to do anything about it at the moment. One, because Alia has rank in the Maverick Hunters and she didnt wanna risk jeopardizing the alliance out of petty envy. Two, because she still had plans for her. 'Project Arcadia' was strictly need to know and Alia needed to know for good reason.

Iris took a quick glance over at her special CD collection in the glass cabinet then back at the screen, still tapping her finger as she watched you and Alia play your silly little poker game.
Since you and Alia had an awful lot of free time on your hands, you made it best 3 out of 5. You werent a wiz with poker outside of when Mr. Hochrin playing a few rounds with you and his buddies teaching you the ropes way back when. You had no clue how good Alia was at the game, but you shouldnt be too worried. Youre not playing for keeps and youre certainly not playing strip poker (not sure how that'd work with a reploid!) so what do you have to lose other than doing her a favor?

First round of was a good start for you.
"Flush," you revealed your hand.
Alia sighed and revealed hers, "Pair. One point for you."
Iris's finger tapped a little slower seeing you win.

Second round was a load of shit.
You had nothing. No good cards.You traded them out for even worse cards.
You put on your best poker face, but Alia saw right through it.
"Two pairs," she shows you her hand.
You shrug and reveal your useless royal sampler. "That's one point for me," Alia smiled.
Iris's finger tapped a little faster seeing you lose.

"Say [Y/N]," Alia started up the conversation during Round 3.
"Yeah?" you eyed your hand and contemplated the best cards to keep.
"I'm curious. How did you know about 'Project Arcadia'?" you almost dropped your cards when she asks that question, "I'm pretty sure that name's been kept very top secret."
Iris stopped tapping her finger.
You try to keep a straight face, but the drawer with that 'proposal' crammed in it was right in the corner of your eye. Acting as if youre TOTALLY not glancing that direction you quickly think of a good answer.

"I... heard a couple of troops mutter stuff about it," you answered, "guess despite the whole 'top secret' schtick, somebody's been blabbing about it. I wouldnt be surprised if I was the ONLY person that didnt get it blabbed to!"
"Well, thinking about it, it does sound a bit too silly to be kept a top secret project, doesnt it?" Alia commented, "I mean think about it. Reploids actually given the programming to give biological birth? That sounds like pure fantasy than actual science. Even if it's science fiction."
You shrug your shoulders as your mood cooled down, "Eh, I bet they said the same thing way back then when the idea of humans and robots coexisting was science fiction."
"Fair enough," Alia stated, "I cant help but wonder how that would feel. A baby growing inside you for 3/4s of a whole year until your belly bulges out outrageously and then FINALLY passing it out through the tight confines between your legs! That sounds like it would be extremely painful. And I've seen footage of female humans screaming in agony as their children are being pulled out of them! How can you guys handle such misery?"
"I dont think I'M the right person to ask," you answer for obvious reasons, "anyways, I got a straight. What you got?"
"Four of a kind." OUCH!! "Score's now 2-1."

One more loss and youre done. Round 4.

"Alright, since you asked me something tight and discreet," Alia started up another conversation, "mind if I ask you one in return?"
"Shoot," you answer, still concentrating on your next move.
"I dont know if you saw that press conference last week," she begins.
"Oh, the one about how the Colonel whipped Duff McWhalen and liberated the museum?" Alia nods. "What about it?"
"There was something that got our attention," your eyebrow twitched as Alia mention 'OUR', "right before Iris stopped taking questions. The one asked by the reporter of City of New Hope Times."
Iris glanced over at Alia, her full attention now drawn to her.

"Oh yeah," you nodded, "that Velasquez guy. I remember."
"That got a lot of attention over at the Hunter base and even though we joined forces and destroyed Space Station Eurasia, people are STILL talking about it. Do you know anything about any wire transfers from any of Repliforce's personnel to Sigma thugs?" Fair question. It got you thinking as well.

"That's news to me," you answered, "I couldnt even tell you if it's true or not. But the Colonel definitely caught wind of it. A few days ago, he sent a couple of inquisitors over going door to door interrogating each and every person they came across. One of them grabbed one of my bodyguards and shook him up really hard. I had to run up to the guy and scream in his face that he was with me the whole time!"

*Ding ding ding!*
As if conveniently on cue, a text appeared on Iris's phone. She grabbed the phone, glanced at the message, then glanced over at you. She quickly typed up her brief response and put the phone away.

"It hasnt gotten any easier on our side either," Alia explained, "ever since that conference, X started to distance himself from any involvement with Repliforce. He didnt even show up to the Enigma Cannon launching. I'm probably not supposed to say this, but I think X is getting pretty suspicious of Repliforce."
"I'm sorry to hear that," you say to her, "give him time. I'm sure he'll come around."
Alia looked pretty uneasy, "I doubt it. Even their proudest sponsor, Dr. Cain himself is starting to believe all the negative press against your employers."
"Dr. Cain?!" you double-taked, "Him?!"
"Yeah. He insists that we start reading more of those stupid tabloids. Shortly after that press conference, he bought a year's subscription to City of New Hope Times and features EVERY single article written by Armand Velasquez. And all he writes about are the leaks."

"Either the world renown Dr. Cain suddenly turned into a conspiracy theorist crackpot," you probably couldve been more tact with your words, "or we got ourselves a mole. Maybe I should bring this up with Iris. Oh, ready to show your hand?"

"Yeah. A straight. You?"
"Straight flush!" you reply, impressing even yourself, "guess this means we're dead even."
"This next round decides the winner. Hope you got a strong spine under all that meat, cuz youre gonna be needed it when you lose!"
"Unless youre giving me a hernia exam, I'm sure I'll be fine!" And with a sudden burst of confidence despite the uncomfortable topics of discussions, the two of play the last round.

As your only audience member from afar watches you, of course... still tapping the desk with impatience.
