1122222222222212332433334.content:
Everybody on the face of the dying planet with a tv or at least a functioning radio was tuning in the Enigma Canon firing in the direction of the falling space station. You watched in on one of the only handful of Repliforce-approved channels from your 4KTV in your apartment. Cinnamon viewed the event from her portable television in her tent. The Colonel watched the firing from outside his balcony. X viewed it via the live footage airing at the Maverick Hunters HQ. Dr. Cain watched the event from the tv in his hospital room as the nurse bearing a Community bracelet brought him his dinner tray.

From this brief moment, the world went silent.

Until the earsplitting noise of a titanic orbital-piercing beam of Death Star magnitude erupted the planet and collided with the falling station! Then when the earthquakes finally stopped, the world went silent again.
Until kaboom.

The explosion rocked the pla-wait a minute! The explosion stopped halfway! Everybody stared with confusion as the explosion started to reverse! Actually, the space station was rebuilding itself! A strong bright surge of energy, possibly the virus, surrounded the pieces and fragments and pulled them right back together as if it was saying 'OH NO YOU DONT! I'M COMING DOWN THERE! AND DOOM IS COMING WITH ME!' The canon not only failed, the world just learned that it's in much more danger than it thought it was!

Iris watched quietly and emotionless as everyone around her either fell into depression or panicked.

"Douglas!" Zero got on his earpiece and began Plan B, "the canon failed! Get the shuttle ready now! ...What do you mean you cant? Well hurry up and get it patched! ...What are you talking about? ...WHO?! WHO DID THAT?!" Zero's face went cold and he turned that cold glance toward Alia, "Lock everything down. Make sure nobody gets in or out without my saying so!" Plan B was aborted.
"Alia! Are you aware your new intern just broke into the hangar, took out security, and set our shuttle to self-destruct?!"
"Wh-wh-what?! Double?! But how-"
"What if Double's a Sigma spy?! Alia, did you even check his background before hiring him?!"
"N-not really. I mean why? All he actually did around the base was make coffee and send faxes."
"Well your coffee guy just single-handedly sabotaged the whole mission!"
"Z-Zero.. I..."
"Because of that screwup, we have to start over. The world's gonna suffer while we wait because of you."
"I..."
"Report back to base," Zero ordered and just walking away, he added, "when you get there, I recommend cleaning out your desk."
"W-WHAT?! ZERO WAIT!! PLEASE WAIT!!" the camera zoomed in just in time to see Alia's heart breaking as she collapsed to the floor, realizing she's just been fired. Poor girl.

"Poor Alia," one of your guards commented, "she's just a nice girl."
"We got much worse things to worry about, you twit!" remarked the other guard. As for you, the event before you was hard to watch. You felt really bad for the Maverick Hunters and Repliforce. Especially Iris. But worst of all, you were beginning to wonder what you were gonna do now. Was this the end? Is everybody gonna die? Is this seriously how mankind is wiped out?! You always knew the world was gonna sooner or later, but you hoped you'd never live long enough to see it.

As you were forced to soak in this outrageously painful reality, Iris, still showing no change in her facade yet many thoughts rushed through her CPU, patted Alia's shoulder and walked away.

Shortly after, the whole world changed. The blast from the Enigma Cannon not only failed to destroy the colliding space station, but it scattered plenty of it's virus strains onto the earth's surface. Random Maverick attacks increased dramatically, more brutal and unstable than before. The attackers were not only more aggressive, but also obsessive, tearing into any and all they believe threaten their prized product of interest.

Strict quarantines were enforced. Your entire city was on lockdown. Nobody and no one was allowed to so much as set foot outside their home. Not even you had the privilege of leaving your apartment! Not even to grab a bite to eat, Repliforce would drop a ration box outside your door and you'd have seconds to take it and shut the door. Your internet was shut down and the only channels on your tv available only played old vintage sitcoms approved by Big R. You had absolutely no access to news outside your city so you were ignorant of the chaos happening across the world. Perhaps it was a good thing. The last thing you wanted was to be reminded that Doomsday was upon you!

When you werent scared, depressed, or panicky, you were bored. You spent most of the day just reading old comics, playing old video games, and staring out the barred window. How you wished something ANYTHING could happen to get you out of your fit of cabin fever!

*THUMP! THUMP! THUMP! THUMP!*

You just had to wish! You dropped your controller as you rocked by the sudden tremors of earthquake-induced thumping! Your heart nearly stopped as heard the thumping get closer and closer! You turned around to face the door as the thumping suddenly stopped RIGHT outside it! It just had to be on the day your security guards were on leave!

*THUD!! THUD!! THUD!! THUD!!*

It pounded HARD on your door to the point that it came close to knocking it right off the hinges! Your blood ran cold. The last thing you wanted to do was answer the door, but it was either you do that or it breaks down the door and charges you! If today's the day you die, what's the use delaying the inevitable?

"Stop! Dont open that door!" Wesker warns you on the tv screen as you creep toward that one wooden barrier standing between you and IT. You take a slow quiet breath and slowly turn the knob.
You gazed at the purple heavily armored winged mech which glared down you with glowing purple eyes, the only thing not hidden under it's helmet! You couldnt speak, you couldnt move, you couldnt breathe. You just froze up. Then it grabbed both your shoulders and you were only microseconds away from screaming in absolute terror.

"[Y/N]!! It's been so long! I'm so glad youre alright!" you heard an awfully cheerful woman's voice cry out from within the Purple Hell Mech! After recognizing her voice, you snapped out of it!
"I...I..Iris?!" you say in sheer disbelief as you regained yourself, "Iris is that you?!"
"Yes, of course it's me!" she smiled, but you couldnt see it under her scary glowing eyed helmet, "I'm so sorry I wasnt able to visit more often. This new job is a bit more demanding than I expected." Hell Mech Iris glanced into your apartment room. "Hm, I see you still havent opened your pornography ration." Now you went from terrified to death to embarrassed to death! "Did I get your personal tastes wrong the whole time?"

"Uh, d-dont worry about that!" you change the subject, "I'm just... glad to see youre doing well. And it's nice to see you finally get some free time to visit. ...And nice mech suit by the way."
"Oh you like it?" Iris noted your interest, "this is my personal riot armor. It's been a while since I needed to use it, but with my new job, I've needed it now more than ever." Combat reploid. Remember?
"Yeah, I must be tough. And I'm sorry I couldnt be there to congratulate you on your promotion."
"I'm afraid there's not much to celebrate right now," she states sadly, "...I take it you've heard the dreadful news, right?

You swallowed hard and remembered, "Yeah. H...how much time until the impact."
"I dont know," Iris answered, "we're still putting in efforts to stop the collision, but with much less resources. The Maverick Hunters are no longer cooperating with us." Bad news.
"Theyre not?! Why not?"
"Too many disagreements," she tells you, "plus they have major problems of their own to deal with."
"Like what?" Iris went silent. The glowing eyes stared deeply into yours, but said nothing.

"Let's not trouble ourselves with them right now," she suddenly shifts gears, "anyways, there's a reason I came here. There's something I wanted to talk to you about."

"What is it?"

"Have you heard of Project Arcadia?"

You think for a moment. "No. I cant say I have."

"Good. Then it hasnt been leaked," she states, "it's quite a long discussion. Mind if I come in? Or if you'd like, we could go on another leisurely walk and talk over it then. I'll suspend your lockdown curfew."
"Um... do you still need to do that with the armor on?" you ask, still creeped out by it.
"Yes," she nodded, "it's still very dangerous outside. This is the best way to keep you safe."

Well it seems like a no brainer. Inviting her into your apartment to discuss this 'Project Arcadia' thing surely beats going outside and risking grave danger while Hell Mech Iris follows you around like a shadow. But hey, the choice is yours!

112222222222221233243333412.content:
This was difficult. One of the most difficult yes/no choices you have ever made in your life, obviously because this was completely life-changing. Youre awful sure there's more detail than what Iris is leading on, but the fine print was far too small to read (and Iris's smile brightened conveniently after you realized you couldnt read it!) but even if there werent any catches (and there damn sure were!), it was still too big of a life-changing decision to make!

You were given the opportunity to have Iris, a Reploid, potentially be the mother of your children. This may as well have been a marriage proposal. And although you were fond of Iris despite the difference in species AND the awfully questionable extreme interest in you, was she truly 'wife' AND 'mother' material to you? Are you really ready to make such a commitment with her? Is SHE the type of person you'd willingly get down on your knees, propose to, engage in holy matrimony, and spend the rest of your life with?

The answer 'yes' seemed to be moving further and further away.

The hand with the pen in it was trembling. She was quick to notice your uneasiness but her CPU brushed it off as the equivalent of 'wedding jitters'. Her CPU was wrong.

You set the pen down and handed her back the paper. Her CPU detected red flags.

"Wh...what's wrong, [Y/N]?" Iris calmly despite her calmness was faltering.

"I'm sorry, Iris," you give it to her straight,"this is quite a large commitment. I need more time to think about it."

"Wh-wh-wh-what's there to.... think about?" her calm facade shattered like glass, "it's very simple. Not at all complicated."
"Actually it IS kinda complicated," you explain to her, "something like this is a real big first to me. And I dont know if I'm ready to go head-first into it like this."
"But... but what's there to worry about?" Iris's calm voice changed to panic, "I mean sure, everyone is scared of being under the knife, but if anything, you'll have far more advantages than disadvantage becoming a cyborg!"

"A cyborg?!" why did she leave THAT part out in the beginning?! "where does it that I'm gonna be a cyborg?!"
"Right here in this clause," she points to the extremely small unreadable text on the paper you wisely didnt sign, "it's a small sacrifice. Proper reproduction with one of us would require altering a small insignificant fraction of your DNA to ensure successful compatibility."
"That small insignificant fraction requires giving up my humanity?" you question her.
Iris sighs, "No. You'll still maintain... I mean this is an UPGRADE for you! Have you ever considered the advantages us reploids have to you humans and thought to yourself 'Gee, I wish I could do that!' Well with this, you CAN! And then some!"
"Well, yeah, I did notice the advantages that reploids have," you admit, "but I'm not sure it's worth turning myself half-robot for!"

"Youre clearly not being rational-"
"No, YOURE not being rational!" you cut her off, "I'm very fine with being human. COMPLETELY human. And I'm gonna need more time to think hard about this! TWICE as hard since one of the requirements is surgically removing a chunk of that human and become a whole new species!"
The more you turned her down, the more upset she got. It seemed like she was getting legitimately offended that you wouldnt jump at her offer!

"I...I dont understand!" Iris had a hard time controlling the volume of her voice, "why are you so hesitant to do this?! If anything, I'M the one who'll be doing most of the work! Youre not even the particular sex that has to go through labor! You have far little to risk than I do! This... this doesnt make sense! This is ILLOGICAL!!" That shouldve triggered a red flag. But instead, you keep your composure even though your reploidal friend and superior was having a hard time doing so.

"I'm sorry Iris," you tell her, "I'll think about this a little longer."
She stared blankly at you for several seconds. That shouldve triggered yet another red flag. Unfortunately, you were still blind to her 'problem'.

"Error. Irregularity detected."

"What?"

"Nothing," Iris smiled as if she wasnt on the verge of panicking seconds ago! "as I was saying, I understand youre very nervous but I promise you everything will work out just fine. Now if you'll just sign the paper-"
"I said I'm not ready."
"Of course you are. Just a simple signature and we're done."
"Didnt you hear me? I said-Hey let go!"
"Here, just a neat little stroke-"
"Let go of me-HEY! THAT HURTS!"
"Please stop struggling, it'll make things easier!"
"I said stop it! Ow! Stop!"
"You know this is for your own good, just-"

*Snap* During your struggle, the pen broke.

"Oh dear, hold on! I'll find a new pen," she finally let go of your wrist and reached into her pockets for another pen, "hm... I couldve sworn I had another here. Damnit, of all convenient times."

Fortunately, she couldnt so much as begin her search before a Repliforce grunt dashes into your apartment!

"Commander Iris, ma'am! We have an emergency!" he spouted, "a large group Mavericks were sighted at the local cemetery!" Berserk bastards are dishonoring your dead?!
"Gather the squad," Iris ordered, "I'll be there as soon as possible!" Good news is that this awkward meeting came to a merciful end. Bad news is that she had to go back into that glowing eyed nightmare-enducing riot armor again!
"I'm sorry [Y/N]," Iris apologized while you were too busy shaking off the slight bit of mental trauma, "we'll continue this discussion later. Dont forget to set your surgical appointment with Professor Isoc." SURGICAL APPOINTMENT?!

"But I said I need-" Too late. She was already gone.

Well that was scary as all hell. What has gotten into your boss?! Sure you already noticed she was acting odd to begin with, but that was on a whole 'nother level! Sheesh, your wrist is really hurting. There were some pretty good squeeze marks left by your friend! Any tighter, she couldve possibly broken a bone!
It goes without saying, but that certainly helped make your possible life-changing decision a lot easier. Then again, considering that odd behavior, she's not really gonna give you much choice, is she?

*Riiiiing! Riiiing!*

Nami used his monologue to struggle against her bonds, but the rope work was really good. That guy definitely knew what he was doing and she didn’t like it one bit.

“I am wearing these gloves to prevent any accidental use of my powers. After all, I like to be in full control at all times.” With exaggerated movements the kidnapper slowly pulled off one of the gloves and waved his bare hand in front of her face. “I am making you mine, Cat Burglar Nami. One touch and you will be totally obsessed with me, I will become your new purpose in life, your one and only. All your struggles will be gone in an instant, replaced by the burning desire to stay with me forever. Can you already see it? Because I definitely can.”

Her captor erupted into an insane laughter, truly scaring the tied up pirate girl by now. Nami was convinced that he was not bluffing. She had enough experience to know how crazy Devil Fruit powers could be and that a single touch of his hand was most likely enough to rewrite her brain.

But every Devil Fruit had a weakness. That guy just said it himself. She would be obsessed with whatever she was looking at in that moment. So what if she looked at nothing? It was worth a try and there were not really many other options left. Taking a deep breath to calm herself down, she closed her eyes completely, allowing the darkness to take over her vision.

But her newfound confidence was quickly shattered as she heard the man speak to her again. “It is no use, my dear. My powers affect you even while your eyes are closed. In that case you simply get obsessed with the first thing you see after reopening them. And trust me on this one, I will make sure that it is me.”

Great. So she somehow had to keep her eyes closed until someone would miraculously show up to rescue her. Not very likely. But it couldn’t end like that. She was a proud member of the Strawhat Pirates, there was no way she was going down so easily. Not without a proper fight.

Summoning up all her strength, Nami renewed her struggles against the bonds, making the chair shake a bit in the process. Maybe it was because abandoning her vision had sharpened her other senses, but she was suddenly hit with the realization that one of the chair legs was shorter than the other ones by a tiny amount. That was all the opening she needed.

“Struggle all you want, in just a few more seconds you will be all mine.”

Nami ignored the creep, totally focused on shaking the chair as much as she can. It took her a few more attempts, but right before he could touch her she managed to create enough force to make the chair fall over.

She was hitting the floor with an acceptable loud crash. Sadly, neither her bonds nor the chair itself took any significant damage from the fall. But that would not stop her from even more struggling. As long as she kept her eyes closed, there was still a chance.

Nami could basically feel how her crazy captor slowly leaned over her, clearly enjoying her helplessness. “Game over, my precious Cat Burglar” he hissed into her ear right before his hand touched her upper arm, infecting her with his unique possession powers. Damn it!

“Hello? Is someone there?” a new voice suddenly reached her ears, filling the navigator with hope. The voice clearly came from further away, but it looked like someone somehow took notice of her crash and came to investigate.

“Seriously?” the kidnapper grunted in annoyance. She could hear hasty movements as well as two ripping sounds right before something sticky was pressed upon her closed eyes. It didn’t take a genius to realize that this creep had just taped her eyelids shut to prevent her from opening her eyes without his consent.

“Just give me another minute, I have to take care of some unwanted guest.”

Nami knew that this was her prime opportunity to try and free herself, but for some reason she was too curious to see how things would play out, so she put a stop to her futile attempts and instead listened closely to what was about to happen with the newcomer.

“Anyone there? I know I heard something…”

“Insolent brat! I will make you regret peeking around!”

The fighting noise was loud but also over quickly. Whoever won didn’t had any trouble taking out his opponent. After what felt like an eternity of silence to the tied up Stawhat member a quite weak “How… Who… are you…?” from her captor´s voice finally released the tension. The newcomer had won. She was about to get saved.

Relief flooded trough her entire body. It appeared like a fairy tale, the hero showing up just in the nick of time to save the damsel in distress from the crazy bad guy. Only that this right now was reality.

“I can´t believe it…” her saviour announced right after she heard him step into the room. “Good thing I trusted my gut and came here. Hold still, I am going to cut you free this instance.”

Whoever that guy was, he followed up his words with actions, and before Nami realized it the ropes were falling off and she could properly move her body again. In gentleman style he then helped her sitting up before carefully peeling off the tape from both her lips and eyes.

“What happened here? Are you all right?”

Spitting the cloth out of her mouth, Nami instinctively turned towards her saviour as she opened her eyes for the first time since she was affected by that particular Devil Fruit.

“Yes, thank you very much.”

As the rescued Strawhat navigator realized what she was doing, it was already far too late. The image of her saviour burned itself deep into her mind, together with a massive desire to be with him, to keep him, to crush anything and everything that would dare to stand between them.

Congratulations! Nami is now officially your Yandere!

"It is?" she turns her head over to your alarm clock, "oh it is! You'd better get back in here and finish your rest. You dont wanna be all groggy later on, do you?" Screw it, just get to the point.
"How did you get in here?!" you questioned.
"Um... I was always here," she answered so casually.
"How did you get in my room?!" you repeat yourself.
"I just said! I was always here!" she repeats herself. You rubbed your forehead. You take a deep breath.

"Alright, let's start over," you change up the questions, "who are you?"
"The Dark Magician Girl, at your service!" she announced with such pride and admiration. You squint your eyes then gaze over at your deck. You reach for your brand new card (still gripping the stun gun tight behind your back just in case!) and stare hard at it.

You look the Dark Magician Girl on the card then the Dark Magician Girl on your bed, giving off the same winking expression as the Dark Magician Girl on the card! Whoever this girl was, her costume had incredible attention to detail. Not only did the costume match, so the spikey waviness in her golden blonde hair The amount of hair mousse it took to pull that off mustve been... geez! You havent seen many Duel Monster cosplayers put as much careful work in their outfits as SHE did!

"Hm," you hm impressed, "that's an incredible costume you got there, lady. You look almost exactly like the girl on this card!"

"That's because I AM the girl on that card," the enthusiastic cosplayer insists, "That same girl that with a single wave of my trusty scepter, blew that nasty Great Beast away, winning you the duel AND the Regional Championship!" She knows about the match.
"Oh, you saw my match?"
"I did just SEE it, master," she tells you, "you summoned me forth and gave me the added boost I needed to smite the awful Angra Mainyu once and for all!" Ugh, she's keeping hard into character. You'd admire her tenacity if she didnt just break into your room and sneak into your bed!

"Well, I'm super glad you enjoyed my battle," you say to her, "however, if you came for an autograph, this isnt the way to get it."
"What are you talking about, master?" she asks curiously, still referring to you her master, "you must still be tired. Here, come back to bed."

Alright. Time to change it up.

"Alright lady," you get straight to the point, "let's just cut the bs here. What are you doing in my room?"
"You summoned me, of course," the DMG cosplayer said with a smile.
"What?"
"Just like that duel against Ali," she explained, "just as your sheer willpower and unbridled faith in the Heart of Cards called me forth to protect you in that battle, so has it called me forth to protect you here. You have my solemn promise to protect you to the best of my capabilities, my master!"
You turned your head, having a hard time keeping a straight face, "Uh... I think youre getting a little into your character there, lady."
"This is more than character, master," the DMG girl continues as she puts her fist to her chest, "this is the might and willpower of a proud honored high-ranked sorcerer of the Dark Arts known and revered since the Era of Akkad!" She beams with pride, "All who dare threaten my master shall face the ultimate judgement that is the Dark Magician Girl!!"

You cringed. This was sounding a bit disturbing. Are you having another one of the dreams where you suddenly found yourself in the middle of a magical girl anime?! Thankfully not, because there's no grizzly bloodshot eyed monster smashing through the window and trying to abduct you.
Since THAT aint the case, maybe it's something else. Maybe it's a prank.

"Ok, who set you up to this?"
"Huh? Set me up?"
"It was Arthur, wasnt it?" you call out, "OK ARTHUR! YA GOT ME! GOOD ONE! YOU CAN COME ON OUT NOW!" You open the bathroom door, then the closet, then look out the front door, "ARTHUR?! THE JOKE'S OVER! COME ON OUT!"
Arhur wasnt around. And the DMG cosplayer was just staring silently at you.

It got awkward real fast.

You were having bad feelings. VERY bad feelings! But you didnt wanna believe them. This girl cant possibly be the real deal! She cant possibly be the same girl on the card that you... dont own and never owned to begin with!

She cant possibly be the same girl in that VR grid that....

....turned to face you.... and clapped....

Oh brother.

"Are you alright, master?" she tilts her head, "if youre feeling restless, it's not too late to come back in here and rest it off."

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
As soon as you walk in through the door, as you expected, the crowd turns to you and cheers! Even some of your opponents you beat in the tournament. Except Ali, who still looked bummed and almost heartbroken over his loss. Despite him, everybody cheered and even chanted your name! Talk about a morning welcome! A morning welcome fitting for the champ of course!

"Thank you! Thank you so much!" you thanked everyone and shook hands as your clingy bedmate smiled almost smugly, like she was getting swell headed over beating Angra Mainyu and winning you championship... er, if she IS the same DMG of course! As if emphasizing that she is part of your team (despite never telling her that she was!) she even volunteered herself in the pleasantries thanking the party goers and shaking hands, ignoring their questionable looks. This was making things awkward, but you thought that maybe it could help distract from the fact that you never even owned a Dark Magician Girl card and hopefully nobody accuses you of cheating!

"We-heh-hell! The champ himself graces us with his presence!" announces Slate, the big brawny Earthy-type duelist who managed to reach the semi-finals coming down toward you, "he aint look like much, but man if he aint know how to start some real fireworks!" He gave you a high five, than a low five, then a fist bump, then a couple other hand thingies you still dont get!
"Nice seeing you too, Slate," you greet him, "uh, this is a real nice place here!"
"Congratulations on your big win," said Kay, the short but very polite fairy-type duelist who managed to squeak through to the semi-finals as well, "that was a very amazing turnaround! I really thought Ali was going to beat you."
"Yeah," you smiled nervously at her, "it... kinda took me by surprise too."
"If there's one thing the Dark Magician Girl is great at, it's taking people by surprise!" the DMG beamed as she squeezed your arm, successfully embarrassing you!

"Aw would ya look at that?" Slate chuckled, "he even got his lady friend dressing up to rub it in our faces!"
"I'm sorry ma'am," Kay politely apologizes to your new friend, "I dont think we've been introduced."
"Oh but you certainly have," DMG insists, "you ALL have!"
"Uh, when?" Kay asks.
"When I made my surprising appearance in the final round of the tournament!" Uggh, here we go!

"Heheh," you laugh nervously, "er, guys I'd like you to meet my... old friend! Go ahead, tell them your name!"
"The Dark Magician Girl," she proudly introduces herself so loudly, people around her turn and give her odd stares!
You swallow hard, "Uh... I mean your REAL name!"
She gasped, "OH! Of course! I'm sorry!" she lightly tapped her forehead and giggled, "my real name is............"

Her smile dropped. Then she gave a puzzled look.
"Is what?"
"Ummmmmm..." she actually had to think about it, "...hm. Gee, I dont think I remember." Aw crap. You really REALLY hope Arthur's just got a sick sense of humor. You dont wanna think the what REAL reason she doesnt remember her name is! Anyways, this was getting you nowhere. It was up to you to get the both of you out of this mess.

"Sorry about that! Once her roleplaying starts, it just doesnt stop!" you quickly come up with a perfect last minute excuse, "guys I'd like you meet Morgana!" It was the best Wizardesque name you could think of to match your spellcaster type! "Morgana, this is Slate and Kay!"

"Sup!"
"Hello!"

"Morgana...." your DMG friend seemed a bit starry-eyed by that name. Something told you she took it much deeper than she shouldve!

"You are so lucky man," Slate commented, ignoring 'Morgana's odd behavior, "I wish I could get MY girl to cosplay as one of my cards! I keep telling her she'd make a hot Mystical Elf, but she'll never do it!" Granted, that's something you would certainly get a kick out of but-“HEY ALI! WHY YA SITTING OVER THERE IN A CORNER?!” Slate's sudden shouting derailed your train of thought AND hurt your eardrums! “COME ON AND GIVE YOUR PROPS TO THE CHAMP!”

And lo and behold, with a dissatisfied grunt, the Championship finalist makes his way to the group, still looking so ashamed of his defeat, he fails to give anyone eye contact.
“Hi Ali,” you graciously greet him with dignity and taste.
“Yes, hello again, brother,” he mutters, still looking away, “if youre here to gloat, please be quick with it. Hurry upand revel in my shameful defeat.”
“Ok!” DMG immediately obliged, “HAHA! As ever, the Dark Magician Girl triumphs over evil yet again! Your wicked schemes of rebuilding an empire have been dashed to pieces under my boot! Not even your precious Angra Mainyu could shield you from the catastrophic beatdown only a proud devoted sorcerer of the Dark Arts can deliver! That'll teach you to think twice before opposite the great-”

“Morgana, stop it!” you had to lecture your stalker, completely forgetting the consequences if she really is who she says she is!
“I'm sorry, master,” she frowns apologetically, clearly regretting her action.
“Dont listen to her Ali,” you try to comfort him, “you played incredibly. You really had me on the edge of my seat! If I didnt manage to pull out that one card last minute, you'd probably be the Champion right now.”
“Hm,” was all that came out from Ali's lips. Guess it'll be a while before he comes to.

“Eh, stop letting it get to ya!” he nearly jumped when Slate slapped him hard on the back, “I aint got so mopey when ya whipped ME! 'Sides, this is supposed to be a party! We're supposed to be having FUN!”

“Anyone wanna try their luck at Karaoke?” Kay suggested, “the booth's unused at the moment!”
“Nah, I'm gonna check out the arcade,” Slate answered, “Ali, you coming with?”
“I think I'd rather have a drink first,” Ali answered. That just left you and 'Morgana'.

“I'll do whatever you wish, master,” your partner assured you with obedience. The choice was yours. What do YOU wanna do? Karaoke? Arcade? ….Drink?

GREAT! GREAT! GREAT! PERFECT! PERFECT! PERFECT! GREAT! PERFECT! PEPEPEPERFECT! That's all you could see when you snuck glances on the Dark Magician Girl cosplayer's side of the screen! It didnt help that you slipped up a few times, but only cuz you were distracted by how unbelievable well she was at timing her feet to the rhythm of the beats and arrows! She shook her head smiling with glee, "Can we play another round, Master?"

AGAIN, this DMG-dressed stalked shocked and amazed you! 'Cake By the Ocean' by DNCE played, when you didnt peek glances at the screen, you could HEAR the loud rhythmic thumping of her feet on near perfect cue with the beats and the arrows! She didnt notice the odd stares you were giving as she rhythmic stamped her feet and even hummed the song along as she goes. When the song ended, again another AAA for her!
At this time, there was a crowd forming watching her perform flawlessly with amazement!

"Uh, who are Diddy and Naomi anyway?" the DMG asked you, oblivious to her own rhythmical strength!
"I dunno," you quickly change the subject, "anyways, I think other people wanna play this game now."

"Can I challenge her?!!" asks one of the onlookers as he whips out a few quarters.
"Ok," Morgana shrugged her shoulders and says with a smile. As expected, it didnt take long her opponent to get schooled. No matter how hard he tried to move and how fast he attempted to get, he just couldnt catch up with Morgana's magical dancing feet! When Jessica Simpson's 'La La' ended, it was a no brainer who was the winner.
"Damn, you were incredible, Morg!" he complimented her, "who taught you those sick moves?"
"That would be Lord Mahad, personal attendant to Pharoh Atem I," she nonchalantly answers, "there was no finer dancer in all the Four Corners of the World that could rival HIS majestic feet!"
"Uh... huh," he gives her a strange look before walking away, allowing ANOTHER challenger to enter the dance stadium. Didnt take long for the poor girl to get whipped by the champ Morgana. Not even the slower but still sick beat of 'Renegade' by Styx was enough to keep the DMG lookalive off her balance!

By the time challenger #3 came around, you got a bit bored of the show and decided to sneak away from all the action while everybody else was distracted.

You couldnt slip away from Slate, though.

"Man... she's something!" he scooted over to you and complimented your new uninvited guest, "where the hell were you lucky enough to find this girl?"
"Actually, I didnt. She found ME," you felt now would be an appropriate time to throw in a LITTLE truth, "long story short, she sorta... snuck in my room one night despite the doors being locked and uh... well, she came off pretending to be my Dark Magician Girl."
"Heh! For real?" that got his attention. You bit your lip and nervously nodded. "Oh, lord have mercy! I'm sure somebody made a hollywood horror movie that started out like that!" TACT, SLATE! GEEZ!!

"Nah, I'm sure she's a good girl," Slate made a recovering statement, "she'd have to be if youre still willingly with her! ....Uh... you ARE still willingly with her, right?"
"Yes, of course! Of... uh....cour....se?" you train of thought begun to change tracks as you noticed Morgana's eerily glowing aura surrounding her as she continued dancing. Does nobody else see that glow?! Are YOU seriously seeing that glow?!

No sooner do you notice that glow, you notice the OTHER glow coming from your pocket! The pocket with your deck in it, that is!

Seems you werent the only one with an odd aura glow about you, however. Quite a few of the people here have odd glows emitting from their pockets or card holsters. Heck, while Slate was musing about godknowswhat, you notice the special card holster around his belt was glowing! He seriously doesnt notice it?

HOLY HELL WHERE DID THAT LION COME FROM??!!! Wait a minute! That's not a lion! It's a liger! An armored striped one-eyed liger sitting aside Slate as if keeping on watch as a bodyguard.
...Hang on, that looks like one of Slate's cards, the Amazoness Pet Liger?

Your eyes widened.

"Uh... something wrong?" Slate asks you as his Pet Liger turns his head to you and stares his one eye directly into you.

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
You expected her to FINALLY cough up the answers you were looking for. You expected a long lengthy deep explanation to all this madness that would wrap up the oddities occurring even if it would lead to more frustration. You expected the truth, the whole truth, and nothing but.

"I am your guardian, the Dark Magician Girl."

And you expected too much.

"...That's it?"

"That's it," she puts it quite simply. Obviously that wasnt the information you were looking for.

"No no no, I dont think you get it," you state, "I need to know who you really are. Why youre really here."
"I just answered you," Morgana tells you, "I, the Dark Magician Girl, am your guardian."
"That doesnt answer my questions!" you raise your voice a little despite the pain, "that's way too vague!"
"But that IS the answer," she assures you, "Everything else, I've already told you earlier. I am your guardian. I'm here to protect you."
"From what?"

"Evil," that was her most simplistic answer which only made your head hurt even more than it already does!
You paused for a moment trying to properly register the stupid answer then squinted your eyes and blurted out, "Evil? Evil?!"
Morgan curls her lip questionable, "Well... not 'evil' per se. According to many, I'M evil. After all, it's not clearly not 'Holy' magic that I master in! Anyways, the evil I'm talking about is the evil that intends to hurt or take advantage of my master! THAT is evil I wont stand for!" Youre beginning to get irritated with the way she just flats out states it so naturally.

Ugh, forget it! Forget it! It's probably better to ask someone else. Someone else who knows what's going on... wherever he/she is.

"Whatever!" you give up, "and what about that yellow light-"
"So many questions, master," Morgana cut you off, "you shouldnt overexert yourself after such a nasty fall. You need your rest."
"I'm not done yet-"
"We can talk even more after you rested off your pain," and with that, she was ready to end the conversation entirely with no new vital info whatsoever! "I'll go tell the others we wont be joining them any further today. I'll be back in a moment." And she gets right up.

"Hang on! We're not finished!" you get up. But Morgana was having none of that.
She turned around and raised her hand, "Please lie back down. You'll just make the pain worse."
"No, we still need to-"

Your eyes widened as you saw the hand she was raising begin to glow! Next thing you knew, purple ribbons surrounded your arms and legs! Before you could shout in surprise, an unknown forced pulled you back onto the bed, forcing you to lie down... and KEEPING you down thanks to the tightened grip of the ribbons! Ok, maybe, just MAYBE this Dark Magician Girl is the real deal!

For a brief moment, that realization hit you like Obelisk's fist. This was no cheap trick. This was no run of the mill overzealous fangirl that wont get out of your hair. This very stalker who was staring down at you with a look of disappointment on her cute face truly was the same powerful mythical spellcaster on the card you dont own!

As if acting on instinct that tends to trigger when you get kidnapped by an evil sorceress, you harshly struggled in vain trying to break free of the ribbons, but the unknown force had an even tighter grip! Like it or not, youre staying on that bed for the time being!

"I'm sorry master," she apologized as your fear amplified, "this is for your own good. Trust me."

Trust a powerful high-level duel monster that could easily obliterate you with a wave of her magic scepter! Good lord, what were you thinking threatening her with a stun gun?!

"Dont worry, master," suddenly her mood changes to a sweet sincere tone as she smiled, "I promise I'll make it up to you by whipping you up a tremendous lunch when I get back! An evil Dark Magician Girl's word is her unbreakable bond!" You dont say a thing. You just silently stare as she bowed to you and then trotted out the door... judging by the way it glowed purple afterwards, she probably blocked off your method of escape!

"Ugh... damn it all!" you groan, as you squirm in the ribbons a little, "how could this possibly happen?! Who gave me that stupid card?!" You then hoped she didnt hear you call her card stupid.

Anyways, so many thoughts flashed in your mind. You had way too many questions and no current way to get the answers for them. For now, you were concerned about your new friend/stalker. VERY concerned what with her not only being an actual duel monster come to life, but proving it to you the hard way that she's an actual duel monster come to life! And what about the others you saw that apparently nobody noticed? Were any of them like her?

The first thing that came to mind was getting out of this place ASAP. And go where? Who knows. Just not here! Though you cant break free of the ribbons, maybe there's a tiny bit of wiggle room to shimmy out of them. Sure the door's probably blocked off, but the window's not! THERE'S your method of escape right there!

"RAAAAAAAARRRRR!!"

And RIGHT as you were thinking that, you notice the yellow glow again from outside the window followed by a thunderous roar and... er... you think you mighta saw a Blue Eyes White Dragon fly by!

On second thought, maybe you just stay and get your rest. Better to be a cute evil sorceress's prisoner than dragon food, right?

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
You are a young human male. No matter where you looked, you never found another one of your species.

You had been adopted by a happy couple. They were blue furry beings who were pretty good at keeping you safe. You lived on the planet Kerwan, in its prized city of Metropolis.

You were in a park and currently using a Pad, looking at various videos. Just spending time while your parents were at work.

===

Courtney Gears was grumbling as she was being driven in her flying car. Her first love was Doctor Nefarious and… that led to nothing but her almost-destruction. Sure, she enjoyed the idea of either killing all the Organics or turning them into robots. But being smashed to spare parts and losing all her backup dancers was a huge turn-off, love-relationship-wise.

Her salvaged parts were brought up by Gleeman Vox and her record label fired her because of her connections with Doctor Nefarious. Vox repaired her, but the bill was so high that she was forced to work for him with no chance of quitting.

Her next relationship was with a robotic high school math teacher, Dull Bookworm. Though they connected over a love of Lunchroom food, their relationship only lasted a month. She dumped him, but he went and put a nuclear reactor in himself. Not only that, he renamed himself to ‘Reactor’ and became a very rich successful dreadzone exterminator. She went back to dating him…

Right up until he was destroyed by Ratchet, the one who smashed her before.

At first, Courtney vowed revenge, but Ratchet then killed Gleeman Vox.

Since that freed Courtney Gears from Vox’s contract, she decided to forgive Ratchet.

And so, Courtney managed to get back her record label contract, though she still had a secret connection with Nefarious. That connection was now just where she sent him money and he sent her gadgets and weapons.

“Is it so wrong for a hotbot to be in love? Every time I’ve fallen in love, either I get destroyed or they do!” Courtney grumbled.

The driver of Courtney's car was one of her new back-up dancers. Slowing down the flying car, she asked, “Perhaps you should try dating an organic?”

“But they’re so… so…” Courtney began as she looked out the window for an example of why not to date organics. Then she spotted you. “So… So… So… Cute and handsome! He’s so adorable!”

The backup dancer/driver stopped the car and looked at Courtney. The hotbot dancer was pressed up against the window, nearly drooling at the sight of you. Following Courtney’s line of sight, the driver found you and asked, “Shall we pull over and pick him up?”

“Yes, yes, a thousand times yes!” Courtney exclaimed before recomposing herself. The car pulled up near you.

As the window pulled down, you stood up and asked, “Who are you?”

Courney leaned out of her car window, making sure you had a clear view down her metal tits as she answered, “Why, I’m Courtney Gears! And you are?”

“I’m Anon. I have watched a few of your music videos, Miss Gears,” You answered.

“I’m glad you have, but please, call me Courtney,” The red hotbot cooed as she caressed your chin.
“So what brings you here?” You asked.

“Simple, I’m looking to improve my image by giving someone like you a job,” Courtney answered.

“I’d have to ask my parents first. Besides, what is the job?” You asked.

“Well, my personal right hand assistant. Most would hire a bot to do that, but I want to prove to the universe that I’m lost past the whole ‘evil’ thing. It was a phase and everybody knows that popstars like me go through phases like tissue paper,” Courtney said.

“Well, like I said, I’ll have to ask my parents. They should be home soon. Have a nice day,” You said.

“Need a ride?” Courtney asked with a sultry smirk.

“No. I have a hoverpad pass,” you said before walking away.

Courtney closed her window and sighed. She then said, “Driver, let’s go to his home. Look up any information you can on Anon and his parents.”

“And if they refuse to let him work for you?” The driver asked.

“I always have a Rift Inducer with me to clean up any messes,” Courtney answered with a wicked grin.

Note from Former 182 : Just a guy was awesome enough to write the first paragraph of this chapter.

Your mother cleared her throat before saying, "Well about that when we found out I couldn't have any children, we decided to adopt one. When we went to an adoption center, we wanted a newborn and found him. The woman at the center said that he was dropped off at the place. No idea of who or what he was or any idea of his birth parents at all. He was a complete alien, but as soon as we got to interact with him, we instantly fell in love with him and never questioned who or what he was and we made sure to give him the best family he could ever ask for. The fact that my baby is almost a man makes me want to cry. He’s finally growing up."

At the moment, Courtney was sitting in a chair in your parents’ living room. Your parents were on the couch. There was a suitcase by Courtney’s feet

Though impatient and wanting you all to herself as fast as possible, Courtney hid it well. She nodded as she said, “Right, right. So, when he becomes my personal right hand assistant, it does mean that he will be spending a lot of time away from Kerwan and by my side. In fact, we might have to do a total communication blackout for long periods of time for security’s sake. While I do believe your son is completely trust-able, some of my current employees and future ones might not be, especially when many bolts are concerned. So, will that be a problem?”

“No, we understand! I work at Gadgetron and totally understand that. Why, the stories I could tell, if I weren’t afraid of lawyers and assassins!” Your father said before chuckling.

“So… Will you let Anon work for me?” Courtney asked with a smile.

“That depends on what you’ll have him do,” Your mother said. “So can you at least let us know a few of them?”

Courtney crossed her legs and put her hands on her knees. “Well, as my Personal Right Hand Assistant, he’ll get any food or drink that I ask him for, pass on any notes or orders I tell him to, carry anything I ask him to carry, drive me to places if I want him to, give me feedback on anything I ask him about, let me know about any problems that are happening or might arise, talk to the press if I want him to, Give me massages or repairs if I ask for them, act as a date for me if I need him to… and that’s all I can think of at the top of my head.”

“So… the dating thing… what if you want to date him for real?” Your father asked.

“Then he becomes my boyfriend, but only if he wants to,” Courtney answered.

“Well, I have no problems with Anon getting this job,” Your mother said to her husband. “What about you, dear?”

“I have no complaints,” Your father said to his wife. He looked at Courtney and asked, “Do you have an infobot or a pad?” .

“Infobot,” Courtney answered before she pulled out an infobot from her suitcase. The Infobot flew over to your parents and opened up its mouth/screen/camera.

“I, Wixx,” Your father said.

“And I, Bevv,” Your mother added. “Do give our son, Anon, permission to work for Courtney Gears and give Miss Gears full rights to act as Anon’s parental guardian in the event we can’t be reached.”

Courtney’s smile grew wider before she snapped her fingers. The infobot retracted its mouth and flew back to Courtney. As she was putting the infobot back in her Suitcase, Courtney said, “You have no idea how happy you’ve made me and how happy your son will be!”

“He’ll be getting to see the stars, like I did when I was in my salesman days. Only he’ll be working backstage at concerts,” Your father said. Then he muttered, “Hopefully, he’ll have a blaster to help deal with crazed fans…”

“Oh, trust me, My backup dancers are well equipped and double as security guards and drivers,” Courtney replied. “You have my word that he’ll be completely safe from any crazed fan of anyone popular.”

“Just make sure he writes to us from time to time,” Your mom said. Courtney nodded.

You walked into the living room and were surprised to see Courtney there.

Courtney waved at you, saying, “Hey, Anon. I drove on ahead and got permission for you to work for me!”

“That’s great,” You said, getting a tiny bit of a bad feeling. You decided to ignore it, as Courtney was still popular and sexy, even with that Nefarious thing was still relevant.

“C’mon, Son! Let’s pack your things!” Your father said getting up and dragging you to your room.

“Don’t take too long or I bet your mom will start sharing some of your embarrassing baby photos with me,” Courtney teased.

If that wasn't incentive for you to work fast, then nothing would.

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
Note from Former 182 : Just a guy was awesome enough to write the first paragraph of this chapter.

Once the two of you arrived Courtney told you to wait in the lobby while she talked to her dancers.
"Alright, listen up! You have a new backstage manager, Anon. He’s cute and sweet and he’s mine and mine only! If any of you even think about flirting with him, I'll make sure you suffer a slow and painful destruction! I mean it! Now then you better give him a warm welcome and don't you dare mention this conversation to him got it?!" In fear, all of them nodded sheepishly.

Courtney smiled and nodded back. She turned around and headed for you.

You had sat down in the lobby. Many stars, singers, and actors came and went. Not wanting to risk upsetting anyone and getting Courtney, you stayed quiet and out of the way.

One or two stars looked in your direction and gave off an irritated sniff before walking off.

The receptionist was a robot and pretty much ignored you.

After some time, Courtney came back with a bright smile. She grabbed your hand and forced you to stand up, saying, “Anon, I let my dancers know about you and they’re all happy to see you!”

“That’s good,” You replied as Courtney took you past the ‘staff only’ door. You walked past various doors that from what you could hear, various movies, tv shows, and music videos were being made.

Eventually, Courtney came to a door that opened when she came near, the two of you entered. Inside was a group of her dancers. All robots like her, but less customized. Heck, the camera people were also her dancers. The director was some small robot that most likely had some napoleon complex, where he seemed angry with everyone. For a moment, you worried about being the only organic, but looking up, you saw a few bobcat-looking beings working the above cameras and microphones.

Courtney clapped her hands together to get everyone’s attention. “Alright everyone. This is Anon. He’s my new backstage manager. Listen to me and then him. Make sure he’s safe from anyone trying to harm him.”

She looked at you and said, “Anon, We’ll be performing a few scenes for my new music video, ‘Cowbot Courney heads West to be the Best’. I know western is not my thing, but what sponsors want, they get. One of them is from a planet where it’s just obsessed with cowboys and such. They put in enough money to my company that I have to make this.”

“Hey, a job is a job. I understand. Besides, I know you’ll look good in anything,” You replied.

Courney smiled at you before kissing your cheek. “You’re so sweet. Just stay in the back near one of my spare backup dancers, right by the snack table. She can send me a mail if you need me.”

You nodded before walking off to the snack table.

Courtney’s western outfit was a cowboy hat, a denim vest, a couple of belts, and leather chaps for her legs. The vest had a heart on the back with her name sewn into it. One of the belt had some basic blasters in the holster with a whip on the back of it. The whip was coiled in a way that it looked like a picture frame of Courtney’s behind.

From what you could tell from the song fragments, it was one of those inspirational beginning songs, with a touch of wanderlust and a wish to find someone. And yes, there was a scene or two where the camera focused on her ass and she shook her rear, the whip being there both focused attention to her butt and made it a bit funny to watch.

You were quiet, making sure not to make any noise out of the worry it might be picked up.

After a few hours of a few scenes being shot from various angles and at different speeds, Courtney said, “Alright, I need a break.”

As you picked up a can of energy that was labeled 'Courtney’s', the director exclaimed, “Break? Break! We’re on a roll! A roll, do you hear me? If we break now, then we might not get that magic going again!”

Courtney gave the director a dismissive handwave. “It’s not my first video. If something goes wrong, we start the scene over again. You could say it’s not my first ‘Rodeo’!”

The director smashed his megaphone into the ground a few times. Whether it was from Courtney’s mouthing back or her making a lame pun, you had no idea.

“Do you need this?” You asked, handing her the energy can.

“Oh, indeed, I do, Anon!” Courtney cooed as she accepted the can. She pondered whose strings to pull to get a wedding music video done, so she could marry you in public, yet be secretive about it. After all, there were a few planets where a bribe here or there could get the two of you actually married while working on said music video. She also debated on if you should know beforehand.

“Who is this!? Get him off the set!” The director said as Courtney drank the energy from the can.

Courtney glared at the director. “He is Anon, my new backstage manager. He’s the reason I’m not acting like my usual diva self today. He gets thrown off set? Then I’ll make you all wish that I was still the diva I was a few days ago!”

“Big deal! You can always get another one!” The director said.

Courtney crushed the empty can. “And I say no. He’s here for me. Just look around and you’ll see that no one wants to upset me.”

The director looked around. No one was willing to look at him.

Courtney threw the crushed can at the Director’s head and the can then bounced into a trash can. The director glared at Courtney as she added, “I’m the star. I have the fame. I have the fortune.”

The director started to stand up before Courtney took out one of the blasters and fired it, revealing it was a real blaster. The shot exploded near the director. “You’re just a no-name director who got lucky. You got the attention of someone more powerful than you and they gave you a chance. A chance that a bot like me can take away. I could kill you right now and a replacement can be found in moments. Thanks to me and my dancers being hotbots who can perform any maneuver perfectly on the first try, all you are is to be a babysitter, someone to jangle keys in front of me so I can complete the music video.”

The Director sat down and slunk back in his chair.

You got a little fearful, as the same speech could be aimed at you.

Courtney turned towards you with a smile. She kissed you once more on the cheek.

“Thanks for the energy can, Anon! I really needed it!” Courtney said. She gestured for you to go back to the table. “Now shoo. Break is almost done.”

So you did.

She was very insistent that you were near her when not doing music videos, claiming that she never knew when she needed you.

Speaking of that, she often had you oil her joints when her commercial shoots ran long. Before work, she had you get up early and either had you buff, polish, or wax her, depending on how she felt and what job she had. From those, you learned that with a mental command, she could make certain parts of her metal body either be almost as soft as flesh or be as hard as tank armor.

She claimed it was a special version of Carbonox, an alloy that was insanely expensive and hard to find.

You stepped out of your room and went to Courtney’s room. Seeing that the door was ajar, you were about to knock and get her attention, right until you heard that she was singing, "The first thing I liked about you was when we met when you were sitting on a bench, oblivious to me. That there was a special something about you that pulled me like a magnet of love.”

After a moment, Courtney muttered, “It could work with that, but it seems more for a date-me music video, but I might be able to use it if I use that line in a brief flashback of the first date...”

You knocked, getting her attention. She asked, “Anon? What is it?”

“We have an hour before we have to get to the set,” You answered. “So what’s the next music video?”

“Oh, a romance one. Since I wanted to see what I look like in a wedding dress, I pulled a few strings and got what I wanted, a romance music video with a wedding segment,” Courtney said.

“Cool. Got a wedding dress?” you asked.

“Yes, but you’re not allowed to see it until we film it,” Courtney answered before playfully booping your nose. “So what kind of music do you like?”

You thought for a moment before answering, “Metal and classic rock. Why do you ask?”

“Oh, just was curious,” Courtney answered, hiding her annoyance. She had hoped you liked Love/Bubblegum pop mix. She thought, ‘So I guess the wedding music will be all my choice, but I guess I can let him pick the music during the honeymoon.’

===

“...And the fifth segment should be outside a church,” Courtney said as she looked over the various sets being built. “No, I don’t care about the denomination. Just make sure that most fans will accept it and won’t complain too much.”

You were behind her, taking notes. Courtney looked at you and said, “Can you get me a can of energy, Anon?”

“Yes, Courtney,” You replied with a salute.

“Thanks,” Courtney said before giving you a quick kiss. Though you did not notice, someone had gotten angry at the sight.

Just as you left the huge room, you felt a metal hand shove you.

You looked and it was an actor bot, one that had been repurposed from a Captain Quark robot. According to Courtney and she sounded a bit disgusted when she told you that he was sent to be the fiance in the music video by some company. With a smug smirk, he asked, "Listen you...you... whatever you are. Do you know who I am?"

"Umm no?" You responded, rather bluntly. You can tell this ticked him off even more.

The Robot Actor began to roughly poke you in the chest as he spoke, "Well I'm more important than you will ever be, you bare-skinned flesh and bone piece of crap! If you even think of trying to steal my shine again, I can have you dropped in a desert with no water and have a picture of your dehydrated corpse shown to your family. If you ever mess with me again, I won't hesitate to do it. I have connections that you will never ever have in your entire life! Now then, if you even think about trying to win Courtney's attention again, I won't hesitate to do what I just said.”

He stopped poking you in the chest, but used the finger to push your chin up and force you to look at him in his optics as he leaned in and asked, “Got it!?"

You feel kind of intimidated but he really can't do that right? Right?!?

"Uhhh... Yes. Yes, I do. I understand," You replied. Even if he was bluffing, he still was a robot and stronger than you.

"Good. Now do something good for me and get me an energy canister, you filthy flesh bag!" The Robot Actor said, dismissively waving you away.

You thought, ‘Wow what a Dick!’

But unfortunately for this dick, Courtney overheard every single word. Sparks of fury crackled from her for a moment before she forced herself to calm down. She sent a command at one of her back-up dancers, Melissa 2.0. With a saunter in her hips, she headed to the Robot Actor, saying, “Hey, handsome. Wanna come with me somewhere… private?”

The Robot Actor stood up straight and gave a heroic grin, saying, “Why, certainly, Courtney! But please, call me-”

“Yeah, whatever. You gonna come with me or tell me your name? One or the other,” Courtney asked, looking annoyed.

The Robot Actor frowned as he muttered, “The first one.”

And so Courtney led the Robot actor to an out-of-the-way room. Melissa 2.0 made her way to find you and keep you from what Courtney was going to do.

Courtney rubbed the back of the Robot Actor, saying, “Do you know what I like best about your model?”

“N-no. What is it?” The robot Actor said, licking his lips in a perverse manner.

After hearing the door lock with a click, Courtney found the Robot Actor’s panel release button and pressed it. The Robot Actor’s back opened up and she pulled out a few wires. As the Robot Actor’s jaw went slack, she said in a flirty tone, “You’re strong, very strong, just like the fleshy you’re based on, Captain Quark. But your wires aren’t secured very well and obviously, your programming is as dumb as the real thing.”

The Robot Actor could only see and hear. If he could, he’d have whimpered. Courtney continued, sounding more cheerful as she spoke, “That organic that you bullied, just because I was sweet on him? Well, I don’t like it when he feels bad. When he feels bad, I feel murderous!”

The Robot Actor managed to make some whimpering noises before Courtney pulled out another wire.

“Well, I’m not going to kill you, at least not directly,” Courtney cooed, rubbing the chin of the Robot Actor with a finger.
The Robot Actor’s optics begged for mercy, even showing the word, ‘Mercy!’, for a moment.

“I thought about that desert punishment. It is rather cruel and I might use it for my next victim,” Courtney said as she began to drag the Robot Actor over to a pod that was labeled, ‘Trash’. “But I think you deserve a worse punishment. Ever heard of Grelbin?”

The Robot Actor’s optics shook, ‘No’.

“Well, a major problem that the mining companies have on that planet are the Arctic Leviathans. So the companies made genetic engineered creatures known as Y.E.T.I.s. However, the Y.E.T.I.s got free and chose to live in peace with the Arctic Leviathans. So now anyone who travels to Grelbin has to deal with the two groups and they are annoyingly powerful,” Courtney explained before shoving the Robot Actor into the pod. Then in an evil tone “Have fun with the Y.ET.I.s, jerk!”

She pressed a button and off went the pod with the mostly-disabled Robot Actor, all the way to Grelbin.

Courtney then pressed her ear, activating her communicator. “Hey, Anon. Everything okay?”

You replied, “Yeah, Melissa was explaining what to do if that robot actor that was sent to us tries anything with me again.”

“Well, don’t worry. After a temper tantrum, he left and won’t be bothering us again,” Courtney said. “So… since the spot is freed up, wanna take the role of Boyfriend/Husband in the music video? If you do, we can market the video in favor of Organic and robot couples.”

“But I can’t sing or dance well enough for a music video,” You replied.

“Don’t worry. All you have to do is smile, walk to certain spots, kiss me, and say ‘I do’,” Courtney said back.

“Well, I guess I can do that…” You said.

“Great! I’ll set it all up, See you later, Anon!” Courtney cheerfully replied.

“See you in a little bit!” You replied before cutting communication.

“Now to get a priest who’ll marry us for real in the video. Anon doesn’t need to know that the marriage will be real for now,” Courtney said before walking over to a terminal and making a search.

Your cries of anguish were cut out by a large amount of water being poured all over you cleaning you to a shine. Then a large blow dryer dried you completely before you were shoved into a casual T shirt and Jeans, before getting fitted into some sneakers.

"Vola! Perfect! Magnificent! Simply divine! You look perfect now get to the stage were about to start!" The bot quickly said admiring their work before shoving you out the door and onto the stage.

You looked around, muttering, “What’s going on?”

Courtney appeared and placed a hand on your shoulder. “It’s the music video I told you about, Anon.”

“Oh yeah…” You muttered.

“Stand there. When I walk by, just keep looking in my direction. When I look back, wave at me with a goofy smile on your face,” Courtney ordered as she pointed at a bus stop prop, where some actors and her backup dancers were standing. “If all goes well, then we can move onto the next scene.”

“Got it,” you said before doing as ordered.

The lyrics were about her wandering aimlessly and feeling empty. When she passed by you and turned to look at you, the lyrics changed to about how she now felt warm and full, but like a robot reactor being filled with fuel.

Courtney clapped her hands. “Alright. What’s the verdict?”

A backup dancer that was sitting in the director chair said, “Perfect, but let’s mix up the bus stop people, just in case the producers feel like arguing.”

Courtney nodded.

As expected, the scene went on a few times.

Eventually, Courtney asked you, “Ready for the next scene?”

“Ready,” you replied. She smiled and snapped her fingers.

You were picked up by two backup dancers and brought to a dressing room, where you were quickly dressed into a dress shirt and slacks.

The next scene was a ballroom dancing scene, where she sang about how her love for you was making her feel lighter than air. She made sure to press her body against you a few times. She looked pleased as punch whenever she did so and you enjoyed how soft her body felt.

Like with the bus stop scene, it was shot several times.

After you gave the go-ahead for the next scene and brought to the dressing room again, you were given a tuxedo.

You were directed to stand under the wedding arch. Thought she was out of your sight, Courtney sang a little bit about how nervous she was, but was excited to marry her love. When you saw her, she was silent, but smiled at you.

Since it was a music video, he Priest-bot merely pointed at you. You said, “I do.”

They then pointed at Courtney, who said, “I do.”

The Priest-bot then said, “By all the powers invested in me, you are now married.”

Courtney hugged you as tight as she safely could and kissed you on the lips for a long time. After taking a moment to calm down, the two of you sat down at the Sweetheart table. She continued singing, but the lyrics were about how she was looking towards a future that wasn’t lonely or empty, but one with you and filled with love.

Again, it was shot a few times. Courtney didn’t seem to mind.

Eventually, shooting ended and the two of you headed to her limo. You expected that the limo would go to the planetary apartment that the two of you were living in.

Instead, it was rocketed towards one of the super-expensive hotels that floated in the upper atmosphere. So you looked at Courtney and asked, “Courtney?”

“I’ll explain in a little bit. Trust me on this,” Courtney answered, putting a hand on your lap.

“If you say so…” You replied.

You followed her into the hotel, up the elevator, and were shoved into one of the Honeymoon suites, right onto the bed.

Courtney sauntered in with a smirk on her face. “Computer, close door and lock it. Play ‘All you need is love’.”

As you heard the door lock and the music began to play, you nervously asked, “What’s going on?”

Courtney looked at her fingers, inspecting the paintjob as she answered, “Turns out on this planet, the marriage laws have an odd loophole. Anyone getting married by a priest-bot on this particular day, regardless of it being an intended marriage or not, will really get married for real.”

“What?” you squeaked.

She looked at you with a worried expression. “I love you, Anon. More than you know. More than I thought that my model could ever experience. I am willing to do anything to earn your love and anything to keep you with me.”

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
Roll.exe woke up and stretched. As a Net Navi, she didn’t really need to. But there were those rare days where her teenage Operator woke up early and had been staring at her, so she decided to give him a bit of a show whenever she woke up.

She knew that he had a crush on the Roll.exe models, as she had found his digital porn stash, which had included pictures of herself.

She was so tempted to delete any pictures that weren’t of the Roll.exe collection, but Roll.exe did not want to upset her operator, as he was a bit too sensitive in her eyes.

He had some female friends, but she had to restrain herself for various reasons. One was that tastes can change and by observing how her operator interacts with women, she can plan for future cosplay outfits.

Like when one of his friends discussed how her usual outfit looked kind of like a bunny costume and it gave her an idea. Despite trying to deny the accusation, his blushing showed that he did like it when she put on a playboy bunny outfit.

After all, he’d grow suspicious if too many friends died from car accidents or house fires, all with the automated alarms having glitches and errors that prevented them from working correctly.

There was also the fact the Roll.exe hoped that her operator would give up trying to date with human women altogether one day and start dating her.

How or why Roll.exe felt so much love towards her operator, she didn’t know, as none of the other Roll.exes that she met didn’t have as strong feelings towards their loves. She checked and she discovered that all Roll.exe models were given slight alterations to their basic personalities, just to allow each one to be different. She guessed that there probably was a big mistake with her personality programming, but she had no desire to have it corrected.

‘Oh, how I wish I could embrace my operator, how he could make me into a woman, his woman,’ Roll.exe thought as she did a stretch that put emphasis on her chest. Opening her eyes and seeing that her operator was still asleep in his bed. She grumbled, “You’re lucky you're so cute.”

Putting a hand on her cheek, she let out a sigh, “If only, if only there was a way for us to physically interact with each other…”

She had heard rumors of powerful net navis who could create special energy fields that blurred the lines between the real world and the cyber world. While she wanted to go look for those net navis, rumors that they were some criminal syndicate made her wary. She did not want to risk her operator getting arrested and herself getting deleted.

Then there were rumors of a robot that Net Navis could inhabit, but it was supposedly in the testing stages and under heavy guard in a military base.

As Roll.exe began sending out her virus minions to activate alarms to wake up her deep-sleeping operator, she thought, ‘I wonder if today will be another day of fixing computers? My love is ever so helpful towards others, even though they don’t deserve it.’

1122222222222222222222222222222222223222.content:
Note from former182: I had some help from Just a guy!

You are Hiro and your last name is Aoki.

You heard a beeping noise and pressed your alarm clock. You smiled at the silence.

Then Roll.EXE called out, “ "Good morning, master! its 6:30 am on Friday, November 27th! So far, you have no new messages or notes!"

You slowly sat up, grumbling, “I told you not to call me Master, Roll.”

Roll giggled in her usual cute way, “Sorry, but it just seems so appropriate!”

You grumbled, “Someday, I’ll get you to stop calling me that.”

Roll.EXE smiled and nodded, ‘And on that day, you’ll have to call me master.’

You stood up and stretched. “So what did I plan on today?”

Putting a finger on her chin and looking upwards (because it was considered one of her cuter poses), she said, “Well, you have school as usual. Then after that, you’ll have your part-time job at the computer repair place a block away from school. Then you will have to come home, do your homework and eat dinner.”

You began to put on your school clothes, muttering, “So, normal day?”

Roll.EXE made a ‘’Uh-huh’ noise. “Assuming World Three doesn’t make one of their attacks, the so-called DarkLoids, or even Gospel.”

You let out a groan. “Eugh… I still remember the damage that the Grave Virus Beast did. So what if every deleted data was restored? There still was a lot of damage done.”

“You did get a lot of money from all that work,” Roll.EXE answered as she looked directly at you.

“But I lost a lot of freetime. Not only that, but I just know that one of those Gospel thugs hacked my email and sent that mail that made my girlfriend so mad that she broke up with me,” You growled as you finished dressing. You sighed, “At least Maylu is still willing to talk with me, but I doubt she’ll date me again.”

Your Roll.EXE long ago decided that if it could be blamed on a crime syndicate, she’d do anything to ruin your dating life to make herself be your only option. She held out her hand against the screen, hoping to pass through it and give you a comforting shoulder rub. Looking sad that you were sad, she said, “Someday, you’ll find that lucky person. Maybe they’re closer than you think.”

You gave her a sad smile. “Maybe… but I think I should just give up dating for awhile.”

“But master! Any girl would want to date you!” Roll.EXE said. She thought, ‘But only I deserve to. Only me. Only me. Only me.’

“I’m just going to relax and just not risk the dating scene for now,” You said, picking up the PET that Roll.EXE was in.

“Never give up, Master,” Roll.EXE exclaimed.

“Please stop calling me that,” you ordered, knowing it was falling on deaf ears. “If you keep it up, people will start looking at me like I’m a pervert.”

Roll.EXE merely giggled.

You thought it was at something innocent, like she couldn’t envision anyone acting like you were a pervert.

In reality, she was laughing at something that had happened a few days ago.

A NormalNavi had entered your home’s computer system, as it was sent by some reporter with a desire to blackmail.

As the NormalNavi walked around, Roll.EXE shut off the ports leading outside.

Searching each room one by one, the NormalNavi came closer to your room. Just before it could, Roll.EXE purposely coughed.

The NormalNavi turned around to face Roll.EXE and said ,”Hello. I am here to do some basic maintenance on the household.”

“Strange, you normally call ahead,” Roll.EXE replied.

“Well, I guess that step was overlooked. Please forgive-” The NormalNavi began before Roll.EXE had thrust one of her seethrough antenna through the NormalNavi’s emblem. It gasped, trying to pull out the Antenna before the NormalNavi began to fall apart into fragmented data.

Roll.EXE held up a hand and the fragmented data was absorbed into it. When the data was absorbed, she said, “You are forgiven.”

Roll.EXE said, “Maybe you should try to fight more viruses and evil NetNavis? Get your aggression out that way and perhaps use that programming know-how of yours to make me a custom weapon? I could still call you master, but in the Samurai and Shogun way.”

You paused before saying, “I’ll think about it.”
